Berdimurat operates a machinery spare parts trading business and owns a small shop made of bricks nearby his home where he sells his products. He began his business in 2000 with a small wooden shop and after years of successful business operation, Berdimurat managed to enlarge the shop and expand his services. His spare parts trading business is quite seasonal, so he is thinking of running a business producing bricks in summertime. Therefore, he has rented a plot of land located not far from his town in order to start his brick manufacturing. Berdimurat hopes to expand his brick manufacturing within two years. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to get started producing bricks.

loan.use: To start a business producing bricks

loan.name: Pork

texts.en: Mr. S. is an old man whose wife appears in the photo here. S. makes wooden furniture. He sells his finished product to buyers who come directly to his house and he transports his furniture to sell around his community. He is married to Chan Chreb, age 40, and they have three school-aged kids. To earn additional profit, S. is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make more products to sell.

loan.use: To buy raw materials to make more products to sell.

loan.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Ganchimeg and her family have been living at the current address for five years. Her husband operates a taxi service in their town. She began her business in 2003 with her supportive mother and since that time, her business has grown steadily. Now Ganchimeg is planning to increase the types of products she sells and expand the amount of customers she attracts. Ganchimeg is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of food products for her business.

loan.use: To purchase inventory

loan.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata N. est une employe de pharmacie comme vendeuse, elle est ge de 46 ans et marie pour arrondir sa mensualit elle exercie une activit de commerce de tissu provenant soit de la Mauritanie soit du Mali qu'elle place au niveau de sa clientle et qu'elle rcupre en mensualit ou hebdomadaire.Ainsi, madame N. sollicite ce prt pour accroitre son fonds de commerce et sa rentabilit en gnrant du profit qui sera destin soutenir ses frres et soeurs et s'occuper en mme de l'ducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata N. works as a salesperson for a pharmacy. She is 46 years old and married. To supplement her monthly salary, she operates a business selling fabric that comes from Mauritania or Mali. She sells the fabric that she collects weekly or monthly to her customers. Thus, Mrs. N. is requesting this loan to grow her working capital and her profitability by generating revenue. Her earnings will be used to support her brothers and sisters and to take care of her childrens education.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business

loan.name: Assata

texts.fr: Ne le 1er Janvier 1963 NGola Kbila, dans la prfecture de Kolondiba (rgion de Sikasso), Madame Assata M. est marie, mre de neuf enfants et rside avec sa copouse, leurs enfants et leur poux, commerant, Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, un des quartiers priphriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Madame Assata M. aprs avoir men beaucoup dactivits sans succs, sest initie depuis plus de six ans cette activit dachat et de vente de fruits (ananas, avocat, banane, banane plantain, orange, etc). Elle mne son activit au niveau des services de Douanes de Sikasso. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientle de plus en plus croissante, elle dcida de rejoindre linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Elle a bnfici de 2 prts individuels qui ont t tous correctement rembourss. C'est ainsi quelle sollicite ce troisime prt qui lui permettra dacheter et de constituer un grand stock de fruits ( ananas, avocat, banane plantain, orange, etc.) en provenance de la Cte dIvoire quelle revend en dtail et en gros une clientle compose de toutes les couches sociales. Elle envisage raliser avec ce troisime prt un bnfice mensuel moyen de 115 000 FCFA qui sera utilis essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dpenses familiales et payer les intrts de son prt.
texts.en:
Born on January 1, 1963 in NGola Kbila, in the Prefecture of Kolondiba (the Sikasso region), Mrs. Assata M. is married and the mother of nine children. She lives with her husband (who is an entrepreneur), her husbands second wife and their children in Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, one of the peripheral districts of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Having tried various business activities without success, over six years ago Mrs. Assata M. started selling fruits (pineapples, avocados, bananas, plantains, oranges etc). She sells near the Customs office in Sikasso. In order to better satisfy the demands of her growing customer base, about three years ago she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She obtained two individual loans in the past and repaid them well. And thus she is seeking a third loan, which will allow her to buy a large supply of fruit (pineapples, avocados, plantains, oranges etc) from Cte dIvoire; she sells retail and wholesale to customers coming from all layers of society. With this third loan she plans to achieve a monthly income of 115,000 West African Francs, which will be used to bolster her business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing fruits

loan.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar B. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. He graduated from 29th school, a special school for disabled and handicapped children. Hurelbaatar operates a business making wooden products and furniture in his town with the help of her wife. The business is very family oriented, as Hurelbaatar designs and produces their products while his wife paints and decorates them. Hurelbaatar started his business in 2005. The business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Hurelbaatar and his wife work hard in order to build a new house in the area where the family currently lives. He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and paints.

loan.use: To purchase wood and paint

loan.name: Man

texts.en: Man K. is an older woman and a widow. Man K. has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family. Man K. also travels to sell her medicine by walking around her community. She now has three single kids and two who are married and live away from home. Man K. is concerned that she is hardly walking to sell and she dreams of having a vehicle to pick up her medicine, but she doesnt have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Man K. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation.

loan.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loan.name: Idriss

texts.en:
Idriss is married with three children, two of whom are school-going. He has a shop in the city center where he sells tailoring materials. He is assisted by his wife at the shop when he is out of town.
Idriss would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to increase his tailoring material stock. His materials are in very high demand and he would very much like to satisfy his customers.
Idriss plans to use the proceeds from this loan to complete the payment for a piece of land on which he has already made a part payment. He also hopes this loan will enable him to grow his business so that he can support his family. He thanks you for your support.

loan.use: To buy more clothing material to sell

loan.name: Famory

texts.fr: g de 28 ans, Monsieur Famory T. est clibataire rsidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle largie Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Monsieur T. aprs avoir men plusieurs activits sans succs telle la vente de carburants, sest initi au domaine du commerce darticles divers pour son Alimentation (Eau minrale, boissons, Dodorants, et cartes de recharge de tlphone Malitel/Orange, etc.) il y a environ quatre ans. Il mne cette activit Wayerma I et est beaucoup sollicit de sa clientle pour la qualit de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientle de plus en plus croissante, il dcida de rejoindre linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux annes et est son troisime prt individuel. Les prts prcdents ont t tous correctement rembourss. Ce troisime lui permettra dacheter 30 cartons de lEau minrale, 20 paquets de boissons NBB, 2 cartons de biscuits, 7 cartons de Dodorants, 500 cartes de recharge Malitel/Orange, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetes auprs de commerants grossistes sur place et des reprsentants des deux rseaux de tlcommunication avant de les revendre en gros et en dtail une clientle compose de toutes couches sociales de la ville. Avec ce troisime prt, il envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilis essentiellement pour contribuer aux dpenses familiales, payer les intrts de son prt et investir le reste dans son activit.
texts.en:
Mr. Famory T. is a single 28 year old who lives in a large extended family in Wayerma I, a sought after neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (in the Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). After trying a number of unsuccessful ventures such as selling fuel, Mr. T. started a grocery store (including mineral water, drinks, deodorants, and phone cards) about four years ago. He runs this business in Wayerma I and is very popular with his clients because of the quality of his products. In order to satisfy the demands of his ever increasing clientele, he joined the microfinance partner Soro Yiriwaso over two years ago, and is now on his third individual loan. The previous loans were all repaid on time. This third loan will allow him to buy 30 cases of mineral water, 20 packages of NBB drinks, 2 cases of biscuits, 7 cases of deodorant, 500 Malitel/Orange phone cards, etc. The merchandise is bought from wholesalers and from distributors for the two telecommunications networks; he then sells at wholesale or retail prices to clients from all walks of life. With this third loan, he hopes to make a profit of 200,000 francs per month, which will be used to contribute to family expenses, pay interest on the loan, and reinvest into his business.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy assorted products for his grocery store

loan.name: Kadia

texts.fr: Age de 37 ans, Madame Kadia D. est marie et mre de 5 enfants. Elle rside avec son poux et leurs enfants Mamassoni, un des quartiers priphriques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Madame Kadia D. aprs avoir men beaucoup dactivits sans succs, sest initie il y a environ deux ans la vente des habits de friperie en provenance de la rpublique du Ghana. Elle vend ses friperies de faon ambulante dans les quartiers de la ville o elle est beaucoup sollicite de sa clientle pour la qualit de ses produits. Elle dcida de rejoindre linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois ans. Aprs 2 prts solidaires (prt du groupe) avec une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est son 4me prt individuel et tous les prts prcdents ont t correctement rembourss. Ce quatrime prt lui permettra de se rendre elle-mme au Ghana pour acheter des balles de friperies de qualits diffrentes (T-shirt, Chemises, porte cls, poupes, etc.) afin de les revendre avec ses enfants de faon ambulante une clientle compose gnralement des femmes de sa localit. Elle envisage raliser avec ce prt un bnfice mensuel de 135 000 FCFA qui sera utilis essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dpenses familiales et payer les intrts de son prt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia D. is 37 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband and children in Mamassoni, a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). After trying a number of unsuccessful ventures, Mrs. D. started selling second hand clothing from Ghana about two years ago. She sells the clothing door to door in other neighborhoods in the city, where she is highly sought after by her clients because of the quality of her goods. She joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance partner over three years ago. After 2 group loans with a neighborhood women's association, she is now on her 4th individual loan, and all her previous loans have been repaid. This fourth loan will allow her to go to Ghana herself to buy bales of used clothing of various types (T-shirts, shirts, key rings, dolls, etc.) so she and her children can re-sell them door to door to a clientele that is usually neighborhood women. With this loan, she hopes to earn income of 135,000 francs per month which she will use to increase her working capital, contribute to the family's expenses, and pay interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy bales of used clothing..

loan.name: Yaya

texts.fr: Monsieur Yaya D. est g de 40 ans, mari et pre de deux enfants. Il rside avec sa famille dans sa propre maison Banconi, un des quartiers priphriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Aprs une formation de thrapeute, il sest vite initi aux activits pharmaceutiques depuis plus de vingt ans. Avec une telle longue exprience dans ce domaine, il jouit dune forte rputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources ncessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font dfaut. Ainsi, il dcida de rejoindre linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il a dj bnfici 2 prts individuels, tous correctement rembourss. Dans le cadre de toujours mieux amliorer son activit, il sollicite un troisime prt qui lui permettra dacheter 10 cartons de Manames, 9 bidons dinzam indien, 3 cartons dAlo. Il sapprovisionnera Lom (rpublique de Togo); auparavant (avant son adhsion Soro Yiriwaso) il sapprovisionnait auprs de son fournisseur Koutiala pour venir les revendre Sikasso dans sa pharmacope situe la gare routire de Sikasso une clientle compose des voyageurs et surtout de routiers. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, dautre crdit. Avec ce prt, il envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec ces bnfices raliss, il compte rsoudre lessentielle de ses dpenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intrts de son prt et investir le reste dans son activit.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya D. is 40 years old, married and father to two children. He lives with his family in his own house in Banconi, one of the outer suburbs of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having trained as a therapist, he launched himself rapidly into the pharmaceutical business more than twenty years ago. With such a long experience in this domain, he enjoys a good reputation and gets a lot of orders; his resources are however insufficient to satisfy these needs. He thus decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, from which he has already had two individual loans, both of which were repaid correctly. With a view to constantly improving his business, he is requesting a third loan which will allow him to buy ten cartons of "manames", nine containers of Indian "inzam" and three cartons of Aloe (natural medecines). He gets his supplies in Lom (in the Republic of Togo); previously (before he joined Soro Yiriwaso) he stocked up from his supplier in Koutiala in order to resell in his pharmacy in Sikasso's bus station to a customer base made up of travelers, and above all lorry drivers. Some of his customers pay cash and others buy on credit. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 300,000FCFA. With the profits he makes he hopes to be able to cover the bulk of his expenses and those of his family, as well as paying the interest on his loan; the rest will be invested in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of medicines

loan.name: Yayah Y.

texts.en:
Yayah is married with one dependent. He has a diploma in Business Studies and has spent five years in business. He has a shop trading in men's clothing (T-shirts and jeans) and is very hardworking.
Yayah is applying for a loan of Le 3,000,000 with which he would like to buy more stock from Conakry, the capital of Guinea. He hopes this loan will allow him to pursue his studies at the university level and to also build a home for his family.

loan.use: To buy more clothing for his shop

loan.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim K. is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a beauty business since the beginning of this year. In the local market, she owns a kiosk where she sells different kinds of miscellaneous materials. She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, and some fake jewelry to people who come to buy anything in the market. Khim K. is married to 30-year-old, Choun Chenda, who is a professional teacher. The couple is blessed with a young kid who is still not enrolled in school. In order to earn extra profit and to make the business more successful, Khim K. will be using the loan she requested to accumulate a larger quantity of her inventory items.

loan.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of inventory items

loan.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Marie et mre de 5 enfants, Madame Bintou C. est ge de 44 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son poux et ses enfants dans le quartier Sogomougou de la prfecture de Koutiala (rgion de Sikasso ). Pour des raisons sociales, Bintou na pas eu la chance de continuer ses tudes primaires, cest ainsi quelle sintressa tt aux activits gnratrices de revenus, depuis bas ge. Aprs avoir men plusieurs activits sans russite, elle finit par opter pour la vente des fruits et lgumes il y a 10 ans. Apprise auprs de sa maman, cette activit lui procure bien de revenus et marche trs bien, puisque les fruits et lgumes sont des desserts quon a tous besoin pour notre bien tre. Pour satisfaire sa clientle en qualit et en quantit, augmenter la taille de son activit, elle dcida de faire recours l institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Aprs 5 prts solidaires (prt de groupe) tous correctement rembourss, elle est son sixime prt individuel dont les prcdents ont t payer sans difficult. Avec ce prt, elle compte acheter 3 paniers de bananes, 5 paniers de pomme de terre, 7 paniers doranges et autres. Elle sapprovisionne dans les diffrentes foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Koutiala et Sikasso et effectue sa vente au grand march de Koutiala une clientle compose de femmes et d hommes, au comptant et crdit. Elle compte raliser un bnfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par mois quelle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intrts, participer aux dpenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans dautres activits gnratrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 5 children, Mrs. Bintou C. is 44 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her spouse and her children in the Sogomougou neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (region of Sikasso). For social reasons, Bintou did not have the chance to continue her primary schooling, which is why she interested herself in revenue-generating businesses from an early age. After having run several businesses without success, she finally opted to sell fruits and vegetables 10 years ago. Learned from her mother, this business makes her good revenues and runs very well, since fruits and vegetables are desserts that we need for our well-being. To satisfy her customers' needs of quality and quantity, and to increase the size of her business, she decided to appeal to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 solidarity loans (group loans) all paid back in full, she is on her sixth individual loan, all of which were paid back without difficulty. With this loan, she expects to buy 3 baskets of bananas, 5 baskets of potatoes, 7 baskets of oranges and other things. She gets her supplies in the different weekly fairs in the villages surrounding Koutiala and Sikasso and makes her sales at the big market in Koutiala to a customer base composed of men and women, for cash and credit. She expects to make an average profit of 70,000 FCFA per month, which she plans to use to pay back her interest, to contribute to the daily expenditures of her family, and to invest the remainder in other revenue-generating businesses.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loan.name: Haoua

texts.fr: Madame Haoua Tour a 41 ans marie et mre de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari sa copouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Lafiala de la prfecture de Koutiala (Rgion de Sikasso). Madame Haoua na pas eu la chance dtudier d des problmes de famille, elle na donc pas pris du temps pour embraser les activits gnratrices de revenus auprs de sa maman depuis son jeune ge. Elle mne plusieurs activits gnratrices de revenus qui lui procurent assez de revenus telles la vente de tissus, de bazins teints. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientle, Haoua a fait recours linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2005. Aprs 6 prts solidaires (prt de groupe) tous rembourss correctement, elle est son quatrime prt individuel dont les prts antrieurs ont t payer sans difficult. Madame Haoua compte utiliser ce prt pour lachat des stocks de tissus et divers autres petits objets Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente dans les diffrents quartiers de Koutiala et Sikasso une clientle constitue de femmes et dhommes au comptant et crdit. Avec laugmentation de son fonds de commerce, Haoua compte raliser un bnfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA quelle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux dintrts, contribuer lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haoua Tour is 41 years old and the mother of 5 children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse and their children in the Lafiala neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (region of Sikasso). Mrs. Haoua did not have the opportunity to go to school due to family problems, so she did not take long to take up income-making activities, along with her mother, at a young age. She runs several income-making businesses, which earn her a decent income, such as the sale of fabrics and dyed damask. To keep her customers satisfied, Haoua appealed to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in 2005. After 6 solidarity loans (group loans), all paid back in full, she is on her fourth individual loan, having paid back all her previous loans without difficulty. Mrs. Haoua expects to use her loan to purchase stocks of fabrics and various other small objects in Koutiala. She makes her sales in different neighborhoods of Koutiala and Sikasso to a client base of women and men, for cash and for credit. With the growth of her store's funds, Haoua expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that she will use to pay back the interest, to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions and to invest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of dyed damask

loan.name: Sindiya (Consanguinit) Group

texts.fr: Sindiya est un regroupement de femme du premier quartier de Koutiala (rgion de Sikasso) qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont maries et mres dau moins 4 enfants. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce darticles divers tels, le charbon de bois, le bois de chauffe, les habillements, les crales, les lgumes etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activits, les membres ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont leur troisime prt de groupe et tous les prts prcdents ont t bien rembourss. Awa C. qui est un membre du groupe Sindiya, fait du commerce darticles divers tels le charbon de bois, les condiments alimentaires, le bois de chauffe, les lgumes, etc. Elle compte utiliser son prt actuel pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en charbon de bois et en bois de chauffe et des fruits et lgumes (concombre, gombo, papaye, ignames, etc). Elle se procure de ces marchandises auprs des paysans producteurs dans les diffrents marchs hebdomadaires tels Zangasso, Koro barrage et Dogonasso. Elle vend le charbon de bois en dtail et au comptant une clientle diverse et varie, quant aux lgumes, ils sont vendus en gros au fur et mesure une clientle compose de revendeuses. Tandis que Les membres du groupe Sindiya comptent raliser un bnfice moyen de 120 000FCFA chacune au cours de ce cycle Awa C. compte raliser 160 000FCFA. En plus du remboursement des prts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu pour faire face aux dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Sindiya is a group of women from the first neighborhood of Koutiala (region of Sikasso) who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 35 years old, married and the mothers of at least 4 children each. This group of women runs businesses selling various goods such as charcoal, firewood, clothing grains, vegetables, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. They are on their third group loan, having fully paid back all of their previous ones. Awa C., who is a member of the group Sindiya, runs a business selling various goods such as charcoal, condiments, firewood, vegetables. etc. She expects to use her loan to buy cartloads of charcoal and firewood and fruits and vegetables (cucumber, okra, papaya, yams, etc). She gets her merchandise from peasant farmers in the different weekly markets, such as Zangasso, Koro barrage and Dogonasso. She sells charcoal for retail and for cash to a varied and diverse customer base; as for the vegetables, they are sold wholesale as one goes along to a client base made up of resellers. While the members of the group Sindiya expect to make an average profit of 120,000 FCFA each during the course of the loan, Awa C. expects to make 160,000 FCFA. Besides paying back the loans, they will use a part of their income to deal with their families' current expenditures.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of various goods

loan.name: Balimaya (La Parent) Group

texts.fr: Balimaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont toutes maries et mres dau moins 3 enfants. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce darticles divers tels, la vente des produits de premire ncessit, la restauration, les fruits et lgumes, les habillements, les crales etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activits, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont leur cinquime prt de groupe et tous les prts prcdents ont t bien rembourss. Mariam Sangar est un membre du groupe Balimaya qui est boutiquire dachat vente darticles divers. Elle compte utiliser son prt pour acheter diverses marchandises (sucre, th bonbons, biscuits, ptes alimentaires, savons, huile, du lait en poudre etc. Elle achte ses marchandises au grand march de Koutiala avec les grossistes. Elle vend ses produits en dtail et au comptant dans une boutique bien amnage, une clientle diverse et varie. Tandis que Les membres du groupe Balimaya comptent raliser un bnfice moyen de 120 000FCFA chacune au cours de ce cycle Mariam Sangar compte raliser 150 000FCFA. En plus du remboursement des prts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu pour faire face aux dpenses courantes de la famille. Elle souhaite voir renforc ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso pour quil ny ait plus de ruptures de stocks.
texts.en:
Balimaya is a group of women from the Darsalam neighborhood of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 35 years old, all married and the mothers of at least 3 children each. This group of women runs businesses selling various goods such as the sale of products meeting basic needs, catering, fruits and vegetables, clothing, grains, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program 3 years ago. They are on their fifth group loan, having paid back all of their previous loans in full. Mariam Sangar is a member of the group Balimaya, who runs a boutique buying and selling various goods. She expects to use her loan to buy various merchandise (sugar, tea, candy, cookies, pasta, soaps, oil, powdered milk, etc). She buys her merchandise at the big market in Koutiala with wholesalers. She buys products for retail and for cash in a well-equipped boutique, to a diverse and varied client base. While the members of the group Balimaya expect to make an average profit of 120,000 FCFA each during the course of the loan, Mariam Sangar expects to make 150,000 FCFA. Besides paying back the loans, they will use a part of their income to deal with their families' current expenditures. They wish to see their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso reinforced so that they will have no further breaks in their supplies.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The purchase of various products

loan.name: Akouavi Angle

texts.fr: A. Akouavi Angle est ne le 04 mai 1974 Adjaha dans le Mono au Bnin. Marie EDAH Grard un chauffeur Angle est mre de quatre enfants tous scolariss. Angle a frquent l'cole et n'a fait que les cours primaires. Angle vit depuis quatre ans dans le quartier Bazounkpa Cotonou, Capitale conomique du Benin. Angle vient en aide son mari en supportant avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y parvenir et subvenir ses besoins, Angle mne comme activit, la fabrication et la vente de matelas et paralllement la vente d'oreillers. Angle s'approvisionne dans le nord du Bnin et vend PK3 AKPAKPA (Cotonou). Angle avait dj bnfici d'un premier prt auprs de ALID avec un bon remboursement. C'est dans le but de renforcer son activit et de satisfaire sa clientle de plus en plus nombreuse que Angle sollicite un nouveau crdit auprs de ALID.
texts.en:
Akouavi Angle A. has been born on May 4, 1974 in Adjaha in Mono Department of Benin. Married to Grard Edah, a driver, she is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. Angle attended school but finished only the primary level of studies. Angle has been living in the Bazounkpa district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for four years. Angle helps her husband and shares the responsibility for family budget with him. In order to provide for her family needs, she manufacturers and sells mattresses, in addition, she also sells pillows. She stocks up in the North of Benin and sells in PK3 Akaka (Cotonou). She already had an loan from ALID in the past and repaid it well. In order to strengthen her business and respond to the growing customer demand Angle is seeking a new loan from ALID.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing 4 cotton bales for manufacturing mattresses and pillows

loan.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is married with two children. His wife is very active in the area and introduced him to the owner of the premise where his workshop is currently located.
Albert is a welder; he has six years experience in metalwork. At his welding shop, he is actively involved in the production of metal doors, windows, gates and various metal tools and items used in homes for sale. He currently has eight young trainees at his workshop as well.
Albert has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more production materials such as metal sheets, iron rods and metal bars so that he can produce more items.
Albert intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate his children and begin to construction a house for his family.

loan.use: To buy more metal sheets, iron rods, iron bars and other welding materials

loan.name: Assiba Flicit

texts.fr: A. Assiba Flicit est ne le 21 octobre 1976 Cov au Bnin. Mre de trois enfants tous scolariss, Flicit est marie DJOSSA Mathieu un lectricien btiment. Flici vit avec son mari et ses enfants depuis prs de six ans Womey un quartier dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Flicit a frquent l'cole et a fait les cours secondaires. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Flicit exerce comme activit principale la vente de fruits, d'arachide, de biscuits et bombons et quelques boites de conserves. Flicit s'approvisionne au grand march international du Bnin Dantokpa et revend ses produits domicile. Flicit avait dj obtenu trois crdits auprs de ALID, crdits qui ont t tous bien rembourss. Dans le but d'agrandir son commerce et satisfaire sa clientle Flicit sollicite un nouveau prt auprs de ALID.
texts.en:
Assiba Flicit A. was born on October 21, 1976 in Cov, Benin. The mother of three children attending school, Flicit is married to Mathieu Djossa, a building electrician. She has lived with her husband and children in the Womey neighborhood of Abomey Calavi for about six years. Flicit went to school and completed secondary courses, and the couple pays the familys expenses together. Flicits primary business is the sale of fruits, peanuts, cookies and candies, and some canned goods. She buys her stock in Benins large international market, Dantokpa, and resells her products at home. She has already obtained three loans through ALID, all of which have been repaid in full. With the goal of growing her business and satisfying her customers, Flicit is requesting a new loan through ALID.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of 3 bags of oranges, 10 boxes of biscuits, and 5 cartons of milk

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her two parents. After getting 10 years of experience working as a tailor, she opened a small tailoring shop in 2005 near to her house. She makes different clothing designs at the request of her clientele. She also repairs used clothes. With her income, she supports her father in the household. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase tailoring supplies and more textiles to versify her products. In the future, she would like to expand her client base and she hopes to open a small tailoring factory.
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been withheld to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.
About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in Lebanese Microfinance since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Microfinance.
At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.
Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loan.use: To purchase tailoring supplies and more textiles

loan.name: Alejandrina Pilar

texts.es:
Alejandrina Pilar A. A., tiene 47 aos. Es soltera y vive sola, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. No tiene hijo.
Alejandrina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Alejandrina se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maz, frjol y papas. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Pea y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra semillas de arroz, maz, frjol y papas. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos tener una casa. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas.
Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Alejandrina Pilar A. A. is 47 years old. She is single and she lives alone in the city of Ventanas in the Los Rios province. She has no children. Alejandrina is a member of the rural village of Valle Alto, located in the Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in the group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan requested from the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Alejandrina is an agriculturist and she plants rice, corn, beans and potatoes. She makes her purchases every month in the cities of Ventanas and Fertiza and in the shopping district of Pena. She also makes her sales there. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, corn, beans and potato seeds. She sees this loan as an opportunity for success. Her dreams are to have her own home. Her greatest challenges are having to deal with plagues in her plantations. She enjoys her work.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase rice, corn, bean and potato seeds.

loan.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen Pilar B. A., tiene 23 aos. Es soltera y vive con los padres y hermanos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. No tiene hijo.
Carmen es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Carmen se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maz en ciclo cort. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Pea y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz y maz. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es prosperar en el trabajo. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Carmen Pilar B. A. is 23 years old. She is single, and she lives with her parents and her siblings. She lives in the Ventanas province in Los Ros. She does not have children. Carmen is a member of the Valle Alto (High Valley) Communal Bank. It is located in the Voluntad de Dios precint, which is an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in all, and most of them devote themselves to agriculture. This is their second loan with the Cooperativa San Jos. Carmen is a farmer, and she grows rice and corn in a short cycle. She makes her purchases every month at Fertiza in the city of Ventanas and at the Pea market, and she sells her products at the same place She is requesting the loan to buy rice and corn seeds. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity go get ahead. Her dream is to prosper in her work. She faces challenges like pest infestation. She likes to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy rice and corn seeds

loan.name: Maryuri Mariuxi

texts.es:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C., tiene 20 aos. Es soltera y vive con el hijo, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 1 hijo, Josu.
Maryuri es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Maryuri se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maz y frjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Pea y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, maz y frjol. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es comprar una casa y poner un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas.
Le gusta escuchar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C. is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her son in Ventanas, which is in the Los Ros province. She has one son, Josu. Maryuri is a member of the Valle Alto (High Valley) solidarity group, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, one and one-half hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members altogether, mainly farmers. This is the second loan they have taken out from Cooperativa San Jos. Maryuri is a farmer who grows rice, corn and beans. She makes her purchases each month in the city of Ventanas in Fertiza and at the Pea market, and she sells her products at the same place. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice, corn and beans. She thinks the loan is a chance for her to get ahead. Her dreams are to buy a house and set up a business in Ventanas. She faces challenges like pests. She likes to listen to the Word of God.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Seeds for rice, corn and beans

loan.name: Edy Patricio

texts.es:
Edy Patricio Z. V., tiene 35 aos. Estado unin libre y vive con el hijo, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Wendy (3) y Elkin (11 meses).
Edy es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Edy se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maz y tomate. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Pea y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, maz y tomate. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es comprar una casa y buscar el mejor estudio para los hijos. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edy Patricio Z. V. is 35 years old. He has a common-law marriage and lives with his children in Ventanas, which is in Los Ros province. He has 2 children, Wendy (3) and Elkin (11 months). Edy is a member of the Valle Alto (High Valley) solidarity group, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, one and one-half hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members altogether, most of them farmers. This is the second loan they have taken out with Cooperativa San Jos. Edy is a farmer who grows rice, corn and tomatoes. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas, at Fertisa [an agricultural supply vendor] and at the Pea market, and he sells his products at the same place. He is asking for the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice, corn and tomatoes. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to buy a house and to look for the best education for his children. He faces challenges like pests. He likes to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Rice, corn and tomato seeds

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Q. M. tiene 58 anos. Es casado y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos.
Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Carlos se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene siembras de maz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Esta prstamo lo ayudaria en mejorar la situacin economica de gastos de insumos para la agricultura. Espera seguir adelante y tener una casa propia. Un desafio que se enfrenta a la familia es que fallecio dos de sus hijos.
No tiene mucho tiempo libre. Enfoca en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos Q. M. is 58 years old. He is married and lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. He has 3 children. Carlos is a member of the Narcisa de Jess solidarity group. There are 15 members altogether, who are mainly farmers. Carlos is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He makes purchases and product sales in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan for his farming. This loan would help him improve his economic situation for buying farm supplies. He hopes to get ahead and have his own house. A challenge the family faces is that two of his children passed away. Carlos does not have much free time. He focuses on his work.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Farm supplies

loan.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina D. is currently in the business of selling bread, cooking oil and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell. Regina is 35 years old and is married to a builder. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

loan.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loan.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel C. Q. tiene 40 anos. Es viudo y vive con sus hijos en el canton de Ventanas en la provncia de Los Rios. Tiene 5 hijos.
Jose es socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Jose se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantn de Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para avanzar en su agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta prstamo mejorara su situacin economico.
En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel C. Quilla is 40 years old. He is a widower, and he lives with his children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. He has five children. Jose is a member of the Narcisa de Jess Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all. Most of them are farmers. Jose is a farmer, and he grows corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. He is requesting a loan in order to make agricultural progress. With the support of the loan his financial situation will improve. In his free time he likes to play with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To make progress with his farming

loan.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar Ernesto C. M. tiene 19 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios.
Oscar es un socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maz, cacao, y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantn de Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta prstamo mejora la situacin econmico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio para seguir adelante. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maz, uno en especfico que se llama longosta.
Le gusta practicar el deporte de futbol y boli.
texts.en:
Oscar Ernesto C. M. is 19 years old. He is single, and he lives with his parents. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Oscar is a member of the Narcisa de Jess Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Oscar is a farmer, and he grows corn, cacao, and rice. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. He is requesting a loan for farming. With the support of this loan his financial situation will improve. He dreams of buying his own piece of land in order to get ahead. A challenge that he has faced in his work is that his corn has diseases and insect infestations. One of these is specifically called longosta (locust). He likes to play soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Farming

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther P. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Esther is 31 years old and is married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loan.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loan.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis Bernardo M. M. tiene 23 anos. Vive en union libre en el cantn de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene un hijo que se llama Leonel.
Luis es socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra del maz y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantn de Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para sembrar maz. El prstamo lo ayudaria en comprar los insumos para su agricultura. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio y tener un solar para su familia.
Le gusta hacer el deporte de futbol indor.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old and lives with his partner in the village of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. He has a son named Leonel. Luis is a member of the Narcisa de Jess community bank. There are 15 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture, like Luis, who harvests corn and cocoa. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas. He is requesting the loan to plant corn. The loan will help him purchase supplies for his crops. His dream is to purchase his own land and have a home for his family. He enjoys playing indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Plant corn

loan.name: Livingston Javier

texts.es:
Livingston Javier A. R., tiene 21 aos. Es soltero y vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. No tiene hijos.
Livingston es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Livingston se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maz y frjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Pea y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, maz y frjol. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es comprar una casa y salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas.
Le gusta jugar indor y dol.
texts.en:
Livingston is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. He does not have any children. Livingston is a member of the Valle Alto community bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and half from Ventanas. There are 23 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture. This is the second loan they have taken out with Kiva partner Cooperativa San Jos. Livingston makes a living planting rice, corn and beans. He makes his purchases every month in the towns of Ventanas and Pea and makes his sales in the same places. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, corn and beans. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to make headway. His dreams are to buy a house and pursue his studies. His crops face challenges like pests. Livingston enjoys playing indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase seeds for rice, corn and beans

loan.name: Ida Kal

texts.fr: Ne le 13 avril 1969 au Togo, Etat voisin du Bnin, A. Ida Kal est marie AZINFAN Rn un soudeur. Ida est Mre d'un enfant qui est scolaris. Ida vit depuis sept ans avec son mari et son enfant Womey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Ida vient en aide son mari et supporte avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y parvenir, Ida prpare et vend de la nourriture (pte de mas ferment avec de la sauce au tomate fraiche) la devanture de son domicile. Ida achte ses produits dans le petit march de son quartier et Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. Ida a dj bnfici de trois crdits auprs de ALID avec un bon remboursement. Dans le but de satisfaire les exigences de sa clientle et d'agrandir son commerce, Ida demande un nouveau crdit auprs de ALID.
texts.en:
Born on April 13, 1969 in Togo, a country neighboring Benin, Ms. A. Ida Kal is married to Mr. AZINFAN Rn, a welder. She is the mother of one child, who has attended school. Ida has been living with her husband and child for seven years in Womey, in the community of Abomey Calavi. She helps out her husband and, along with him, supports the family. To do so, she makes and sells food (a kind of fermented polenta served with fresh tomato sauce) in front of her home. She gets her supplies at the small market in her district and at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Ida has already benefited from three loans from ALID and has repaid them. With the goal of satisfying the requirements of her customers and to expand her business, she is asking for a new loan from ALID.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying 5 sacks of corn and 3 baskets of condiments

loan.name: Angela Lastenia

texts.es:
Angela Lastenia B. A., tiene 27 aos. Es soltero y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 4 hijos, Jhair (8), Damian (6), Rodrigo (4) y Tatiana (1).
Angela es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Angela se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maz en ciclo cort. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Pea y las vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz y maz. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas. Le gusta jugar ftbol.
texts.en:
Angela is 27 years old, single and lives with her children in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. She has four children: Jhair (8), Damian (6), Rodrigo (4) and Tatiana (1). Angela is a member of the "Valle Alto" (High Valley) community bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture. This is the second loan they have taken out with Kiva partner Cooperativa San Jos. Angela make a living in agriculture, planting rice and corn in short cycles. She makes her purchases every month in the towns of Ventanas and Pea and makes her sales in the same places. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice and corn. She thinks the loan is an opportunity to make headway. Her dreams are to move forward with her studies. Her crops face challenges like pests. She enjoys playing soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase seeds for rice and corn

loan.name: Hannah Mugure

texts.en:
Hannah has been in stone extraction since 2003. She is 31 years old and a single mother of six school-going children.
She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to add more casual workers in her quarry to help in extraction.
Hannah hopes to buy several pieces of land for extraction of stone in the future.

loan.use: To add more casual workers to work on her site.

loan.name: Rose Mukuhi

texts.en:
Rose is 31 years old, married to Wathumba Chege, and they have three children. She ventured into quarrying and stone extraction two years ago, which has proven to be successful, and she now wants to buy another piece of land to be able to extract more stones.
She hopes to be extracting stones in large quantities in the future and to be a major supplier.

loan.use: To buy another extraction site

loan.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has been involved in tailoring and dressmaking for five years now. She is 26 years old, married to Joseph Maina, and they have one child.
She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more fabric from which she will make more dresses to sell and meet the demands of her customers.
Eunice hopes to continue in dressmaking and become a big market player in both tailoring and dressmaking in the future.

loan.use: to buy more fabric for sewing

loan.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La seora Paulina S. C., es Madre soltera y trabaja para mantener a su familia, tiene tres hijos ya que su pareja la abandono cuando ella estaba con su hijo apenas nacido y desde entonces ella se hace cargo de su familia.
Paulina S. C. es un seora muy trabajadora, se dedica al cultivo de arroz y naranja, es madre de tres hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educacin, ella al igual que su hijo mayor se levantan muy temprano a trabajar en su chaco para que sus plantaciones sean buenas y as poder venderlas al mercado local ms cercano y todos los das tiene la misma rutina.
La seora Paulina S. C. se apersono a las oficinas por un comentario de uno de sus vecinos el cual le comento que en CIDRE daban crditos para la produccin y que el actualmente saco un crdito y que mejoro su produccin gracias al CIDRE, la seora paulina vino en busca de un crdito para comprar plantines y as mejorar un poco su produccin; para poder llevar una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Paulina S. C. is a single mother who works to support her family. She has three children, and was abandoned by her husband when her child had just been born. Since that time, she has been responsible for her family. Paulina S. C. is a hard-working woman. She grows rice and oranges, and is the mother of three children, whom she helps and supports in their education. Along with her oldest child, she rises early to work on her farm, so that her crops will be good and she can sell them at the closest local market. She follows the same routine every day. Paulina S. C. came to the office because of a comment made by one of her neighbors, who said that CIDRE would give loans for production, and that he had taken out a loan and improved his production, thanks to CIDRE. Paulina came to ask for a loan to buy seedlings and thus improve her production a little, in order to have a better life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of supplies for orange harvest

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Motorcycle repair

loan.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El Seor Ronald Snchez Meja es una persona que desde muy joven se fue de su hogar, en busca de trabajo, el llego a Ivirgarzama donde cont con la ayuda de su hermana mayor, es soltero y no tiene hijos.
Actualmente el trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis 2 de Agosto es muy responsable en la labor que desempea, se levanta a muy tempranas horas por la maana para brindar sus servicios con el apoyo de su sindicato ya que ellos les otorgan turnos en las diferentes paradas que actualmente cuenta el sindicato.
El seor Ronald Snchez Meja se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compaeros del sindicato para poder saber algo de crditos y si es que poda solicitar uno para la compra de un vehculo (motocicleta) para as poder facilitar la vida que lleva, y as poder tener ms ingresos para su bienestar propio y as en un fututo poder formar una familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ronald Snchez Meja Leith left his home in search of work when he was very young. He arrived in Ivirgarzama, where he got help from his older sister. He is single and has no children. He currently works with the 2 de Agosto moto taxi union, and is very responsible about his work. He rises at very early hours every morning to provide his services, and receives help from the union. The union assigns turns to the different stops that it controls. Mr. Ronald Snchez Meja came to CIDRE, after hearing from his coworkers, to learn about loans and to see if he could request one to buy a vehicle (motorcycle) that would help simplify his life. This would allow him to earn a greater income for his own well being, which would allow him to start a family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Motorcycle

loan.name: Zinunula Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
Ten years ago, it was savings from his farming and brick making businesses that facilitated and spawned the establishment of his current commercial motorcycle business in Bujjuko-Mpigi. This is all taken into perspective by 35-year-old Baliza J., as he makes unprecedented progress in his business.
This cheerful and sturdy father of five says he has been able to live within his means with an income of $14 a week. While the idea of getting back into full scale farming is alluring, he says he is comfortable doing it on a small scale just now.
He considers himself somebody who likes to create a relaxed and pleasant atmosphere around other people. He says that attribute has been his strength in attracting customers.
With this loan, he is looking at diversifying into poultry. He says with this money he is going to buy chickens to resell.

loan.use: The purchase of chickens for reselling

loan.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira Q. M. tiene 43 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantn de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Jacinto y Jefre.
Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene siembras de maz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantn de Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para comprar los insumos, abonos, y semillas de agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta prstamo mejoraria la situacin economico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maz, uno en especfico que se llama longosta.
Le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira Q. M. is 43 years old. She is married and lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 2 children named Jacinto y Jefre. Rosa is a member of the Narcisa de Jess solidarity group. There are 15 members altogether, mostly farmers. Rosa is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She makes her purchases and product sales in Ventanas Canton. She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers and seeds, so that with the help of this loan she will improve her economic situation. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. One challenge that she has faced in her work is diseases in her corn and pests, and one pest in particular called longosta. In her free time, she likes to spend time at home.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: agriculture

loan.name: Edison Enrique

texts.es:
Edison Enrique C. R., tiene 24 aos. Es soltero y vive con la mama, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 1 hijo, Edison.
Edison es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Edison se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maz y frjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Pea o en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, maz y frjol. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Edison Enrique C. R. is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the Ventanas province of Los Rios. He has one son, Edison. Edison is a member of the community bank "Valle Alto," which is located in Voluntad de Dios precinct, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. This is their second loan with the San Jos Cooperative. Edison works in agriculture. He plants rice, corn, and beans. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas and sells his products in the Pea commercial center or in the same location. He is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, corn, and beans. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to advance himself. His dreams are to go further in his studies. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases. He likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy seeds for rice, corn, and beans

loan.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz P. G. tiene 33 anos. Vive soltera en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos de 16, 9, y 6 anos.
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maz y a trabajo laboral con su vecino. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Ventanas.
Solicita el prstamo para trabajar en labores agrcolas como maiz. El apoyo del prstamo cambiaria mucho su vida. Lo permitir comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que se pone en el cultivo de maz. Su sueno es tener una casa propia y darles a sus hijos una buena educacin. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maz, uno en especfico que se llama longosta.
Le gusta ver las noticias en la noche.
texts.en:
Maria Luz P. G. is 33 years old, single, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ros. She has three children (ages 16, 9, and 6).

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Narcisa de Jess. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Maria is a farmer who grows corn and also performs work for her neighbor. She buys and sells her products in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her farming activities, such as growing corn. The support provided through this loan will bring great change to her life. It will allow her to buy the supplies and fertilizers she needs to grow corn. Her dream is to have her own home and provide her children with a good education. The challenges she faces in her work include the diseases and pests that impact her corn. One of these pests is known as langosta.

At night, Maria enjoys watching the news.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase supplies & fertilizers for growing corn

loan.name: Dora Clemencia

texts.es:
Dora Clemencia R. C., tiene 24 aos. Es soltero y vive con la mama, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 1 hijo, Edison.
Dora es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Dora se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maz y frjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Pea o en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, maz y frjol. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos seguir adelante con la bendicin de Dios y el apoyo de la cooperativa San Jose. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dora Clemencia R. C. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her mother in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ros. She has a son named Edison.

Dora is a member of the Communal Bank Valle Alto (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San Jos.

Dora is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Pea commercial market which is in the same area.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams include moving forward with Gods blessing and the support of Cooperativa San Jos. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Dora enjoys working so that she can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans

loan.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es:
Maria Narcisa C. A., tiene 31 aos. Es soltero y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 4 hijos, Julia (13), Jose (11), Anahi (4) y Johan (7).
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Maria se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maz y frjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Pea o en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, maz y frjol. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos salir adelante. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Narcisa C. A. is 31 years old, single, and lives with her four children in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ros. Her childrens names are Julia (age 13), Jos (age 11), Anahi (age 4), and Johan (age 7).

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Valle Alto (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This is the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San Jos.

Maria is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Pea commercial market which is also in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to succeed. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Maria enjoys working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans

loan.name: Elsa Mariana

texts.es:
Elsa Mariana S. M. tiene 20 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provncia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos, una de 4 anos y otra de 3 meses.
Elsa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Elsa se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz, maz, yuca, y platano. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas.
Solicita esta prstamo para avanzar en su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta prstamo mejoraria la situacin economico de gastos de insumos. Su sueno es seguir adelante y progresar. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maz, uno en especfico que se llama longosta.
Con su tiempo, trabaja y hace cosas en la casa, y a veces se va de paseo.
texts.en:
Elsa Mariana S. M. is 20 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ros. She has two children, ages 4 and 3 months.

Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank Narcisa de Jess. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Elsa is a farmer who grows rice, corn, cassava, and bananas. She buys and sells her products in the canton of Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan so that she can make progress in her farming activities. With the support provided through this loan, she will be able to improve her financial situation and pay for supplies and expenses. Her dream is to become successful and continue advancing. One challenge that she faces in her work is fighting pests that can ruin her corn. One of these pests is known as langosta.

Elsa spends her time working and making things at home, but sometimes she enjoys going for a walk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in her farming activities

loan.name: Romulo Alvaro

texts.es:
El Romulo Alvaro V. P. es un Joven Soltero que vive en la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona conocida como Las Cuadras. Romulo apenas terminada su carrera de Medicina ya es parte del Ministerio de Salud y Deportes trabajando como Residente Medico en la Comunidad Aguirre II a unos cuantos kilmetros de Sacaba. Romulo trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud y Deporte hace ms o menos 4 aos. El mercado es sumamente amplio puesto que la falta de mdicos en las diferentes provincias de nuestro pas es un problema bastante grande y es gracias a personas como Romulo que la gente pobre de las zonas ms alejadas de Bolivia pueden tener Atencin Medica.
Romulo requiere el crdito para poder comprar Instrumentos Mdicos para poder brindar un mejor servicio a la gente de la comunidad donde trabaja y de esa manera ser un mejor medico. Su mayor sueo es poder algn da tener dinero suficiente para poder abrir una clnica y ayudar a la gente de bajos recursos.
texts.en:
Romulo Alvaro V. P. is a young single man who lives in Cochabama in the section known as Las Cuadras. With medical studies barely completed, Romulo joined the Ministry of Health and Sports, working as a resident in the Aguirre II Community, located some kilometers from Sacaba. Romulo has worked in the Ministry of Health and Sports for approximately 4 years. The market is wide open, since the lack of doctors in the various provinces of our country is a major problem. Thanks to people such as Romulo, the poor in Bolivias most remote areas can have access to medical care. Romulo needs a loan to buy medical instruments in order to offer better service to the people in the community where he works, and thus be a better physician. His greatest dream is to some day have sufficient funds to open a clinic and help those who have little.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of medical instruments

loan.name: Vernica Mercedes

texts.es:
Vernica Mercedes C. F., tiene 26 aos. Estado civil union libre y vive con los hijos y con el compaero, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 3 hijos, Darling (10), Andy (9) y Erick (5).
Vernica es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Vernica se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y frjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Pea o en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz y frjol. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos comprar un carro y tener un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta vender productos por medio de revista.
texts.en:
Vernica Mercedes C. F. is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with her children and companion in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ros. The names of her three children are Darling (age 10), Andy (age 9), and Erick (age 5).

Vernica is a member of the Communal Bank Valle Alto (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This is the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San Jos.

Vernica is a farmer who grows rice and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Pea commercial market which is in the same area.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams include buying a car and opening a business in Ventanas. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Vernica enjoys products that are sold through magazines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice and beans

loan.name: Rosa Grimaneza

texts.es:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T. tiene 27 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama Rolando.
Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maz y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas.
Solicita esta prstamo para el trabajo de la agricultura. Con el apoyo del credito mejorara su situacin economico de gastos de insumos.
Le gusta jugar con su hijo en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T. is 27 years old. She is married and lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has 1 son whose name is Rolando. Rosa is a member of the Narcisa de Jess rural bank. There are 15 members in total and most of them work in agriculture. Rosa works in agriculture growing corn and cacao. She buys and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is asking for this loan for the agricultural work. With the support of this loan, she will improve her financial situation with the materials costs. She likes to play with her son in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Agriculture

loan.name: Pedro Dario

texts.es:
Pedro Dario B. A., tiene 26 aos. Es soltero y vive con los hermanos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Juan (14) y Yocelin (18).
Pedro es un soci de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
