Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, frjol y maz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Pea o en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, frjol y maiz. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos comprar un carro y tener un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta rendir homenaje a Dios.
texts.en:
Dario B. Pedro A. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his brothers in Ventanas, in Los Ros province. He has two sons, Juan (14) and Yocelin (18). Pedro is a member of the "Valle Alto" communal bank, located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, about an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of them working in agriculture. This is the second loan they are requesting through Cooperativa San Jos. Pedro works in agriculture. He plants rice, beans and corn. He makes his purchases once a month in Ventanas and sells his products in Comercial Pea or in the village. He requests the loan to buy rice, beans and corn seeds. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to progress. His dream is to buy a car and start a business in Ventanas. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases. He likes to pay homage to God.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy rice, beans and corn seeds.

loan.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes C. Q. tiene 32 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 4 hijos que se llaman Miriam, Jonathan, Alex, y Dayona.
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maz y arroz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantn de Ventanas.
Solicita el crdito para comprar insumos para su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta prstamo mejorara la situacin econmica de comprar insumos. Su sueno es comprar una tierra propia. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maz, una en especfico que se llama longosta.
En su tiempo libre arregla y hace todo las cosas en la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes C. Q. is 32 years old. She is married and lives in the municipality of Ventanas, Los Rios province. She has four children called Miriam, Jonathan, Alex and Dayona. Maria is a member of the Narcisa de Jess communal bank. There are 15 members in total, most of whom work in agriculture. Maria works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys and sells produce in the municipality of Ventanas. She requests a loan to buy raw materials for her agricultural business. The loan with improve her financial situation and enable her to buy raw materials. Her dream is to own land. A challenge she faces in her work is pests attacking corn crops, in particular the "longosta" type. In her free time she tidies her home and does the housework.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy raw materials for agriculture.

loan.name: Maxima Narcisa

texts.es:
Maxima Narcisa G. R., tiene 27 aos. Es soltera y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Mariuxi (6) y Antoni (11 meses).
Maxima es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Valle Alto, que est ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo prstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San Jos.
Maxima se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, frjol y maz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Pea o en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de arroz, frjol y maiz. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos comprar un carro y una casa en la ciudad de Ventanas. Enfrenta desafos como las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta rendir homenaje a Dios.
texts.en:
Maxima Narcisa G. R. is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her children in Ventanas, a province of Los Ros. She has two children: Mariuxi, age 6, and Antoni, age 11 months. Maxima is a member of the rural loan program, "Valle Alto," which is located in precinct Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half outside Ventanas. There are 23 group members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the group's second loan with the San Jos Cooperative. Maximo works in agriculture; she grows rice, beans, and corn. She does her shopping every month in the city of Ventanas, and she sells her products in the Pea market or the same place she shops. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, beans, and corn. She believes the loan gives her the opportunity to get ahead in life. Her dreams are to buy a car and a house in the city of Ventanas. She faces challenges like plagues and sicknesses. She likes to pay tribute to God.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying seeds of rice, beans, and corn

loan.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: Olivia es una mujer madre de dos hijos, comerciante, desde hace varios aos, logro poner una pulpera en donde vende variedad de productos, Gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos ha mejorado el servicio en sus ventas y ahora con los financiamientos, de la institucin ha mejorado el nivel de crecimiento. Ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con poca mercadera, la que ha venido a mejorar con el apoyo de Afodenic. Con sus prstamos aumenta la inversin, ya que lo que ms desea es mantener en equilibrio sus ventas. Es por eso comprara: cinco quintales de arroz, tres quintales de frijoles, azcar, maz, bidones de aceite, productos lcteos, carne, pollo. Y otras variedades de productos logrando aumentar las ventas. Y as mejorar sus ganancias para pagar los gastos bsicos y cubrir las necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Olivia is a trader and she has two children. Many years ago she succeeded in opening a corner shop where she sells a variety of products. Thanks to her husband and her childrens support, she has improved her selling service, and now, thanks to the loans obtained from this institution, she has sped up the growth pace of her activity, as when she started the amount of product she sold was small, but this has improved with Afodenics support. Since what she mostly desires is to keep her sales at balance, she uses her loans to invest, and with this one she will buy 5 quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of rice, 3 quintals of beans, sugar, maize, oil drums, dairy products, meat, chicken and a variety of other products, in order to succeeded in increasing her sales, thus improving her incomes and being able to pay for basic expenses and to cover her personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a variety of products to increase her sales.

loan.name: Vernica Yolanda

texts.es:
Vernica Yolanda Q. T. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Carmen y Anita.
Vernica es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Vernica se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz, maz, y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas.
Solicita esta prstamo para su agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta prstamo espera mejorar y seguir adelante. Su sueno es comprar una casa para su familia y un terreno propio. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maz, uno en especfico que se llama longosta.
Le gusta trabajar y cuando tiene tiempo libre, juega con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vernica Yolanda Q. T. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has two children, Carmen and Anita. Vernica is a member of the Narcisa de Jess Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Vernica is a farmer, and she plants rice, corn, and cacao. She makes her purchases and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan for farming. With the support from this loan she hope to improve and get ahead. Her dream is to buy a house for her family and to buy her own piece of land. One of the challenges she faces in her work is the pest infestation of her corn. Specifically, one of them is called longosta (locust). She likes working, and when she has free time she plays with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Farming

loan.name: Yolanda Beatriz

texts.es:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantn de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios.
Yolanda es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Yolanda se dedica a la siembra de maz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantn de Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para seguir su agricultura y sembrar cacao. El prstamo lo ayudara en mejorar su situacin economico. Su sueno es tener un propio terreno.
En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Yolanda is a member of the Narcisa de Jess Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Yolanda grows corn and rice. She makes her purchases and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan to continue farming and to plant cacao. The loan will help her improve her economic situation. Her dream is to have her own land. In her free time she likes to play with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To continue farming and to plant cacao

loan.name: Sisa Chela

texts.es:
Sisa Chela S. M. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantn de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Fernando y Israel.
Sisa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Sisa se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maz, cacao, platano, y yuca. Hace las compras de sus productos en el cantn Echeondia y las ventas de sus productos en el cantn de Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para su agricultura. El apoyo del crdito mejorara su situacin economico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maz, una en especfico que se llama longosta.
texts.en:
Sisa Chela S. M. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has two children, Fernando and Israel. Sisa is a member of the Narcisa de Jess Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. She is a farmer, and she grows corn, cacao, bananas, and yucca. She makes her purchases in the Echeondia canton, and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan for farming. With the support from this loan she hopes to improve her economic situation. Her dream is to buy her own piece of land. One of the challenges she faces in her work is the pest infestation of her corn. Specifically, one of them is called longosta (locust).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Farming

loan.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Seora Alejandra L. es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayuda mucho a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, tiene dos hijos pequeos y ella tiene un pequeo negocio en su casa donde corta pelo. Requieren este crdito ya que quiere cambiar la puerta de entrada de el lugar en donde la tiene actualmente, ya que la puerta esta en el lugar en donde quiere construir un cuarto para ah colocar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra L. is hardworking and entrepreneurial. Her husband helps her a lot with household expenses. They have 2 young children and Alejandra runs a small hair salon in her home. She needs this loan for construction. Alejandra plans to remove the front door and build an additional room where she can relocate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To change the front door.

loan.name: Juan Javier

texts.es: El seor Javier trabaja en un Restaurant de Mesero, la mayor parte del da esta en su empleo, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar. Tienen una hija pequea, ellos quieren una mejor calidad de vida para ellos y su pequea hija. Es por eso que requieren de este prstamo para empezar la construccin de un cuarto, levantando los muros y con unos ahorros que el tiene terminar el cuarto de su hija. Para realizar su proyecto de vivienda necesita comprar el material para la construccin. El pasa la mayor parte del da en su empleo, es por eso que en la fotografa aparece solo su esposa.
texts.en:
Javier works at the Mesero Restaurant. He spends most of his day on the job, while his wife is a homemaker. They have a small daughter. They would like a better quality of life for themselves and their daughter. They are therefore asking for money to supplement their savings so that they can build a bedroom for their daughter and raise the walls of their house. In order to do these renovations, they must buy construction material. Because Javier spends most of his day at work, only his wife appears in this photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a wall

loan.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria R. R. tiene 20 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provncia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hija que se llama Silvia.
Luz es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jess. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Luz se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas.
Solicita el credito para avanzar en su agricultura. El apoyo de este prstamo ayudara la situacin economica de gastos de insumos. Su sueno es tener un terreno. Un desafo que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maz, uno en especfico que se llama longosta.
En su tiempo, trabaja y pasa tiempo con su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Maria R. R. is 20 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ros. She has a daughter named Silvia.

Luz is a member of the Communal Bank Narcisa de Jess. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Luz is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in the canton of Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan so that she can make progress in her farming activities. The support provided through these funds will help improve her financial situation and pay for supplies and expenses. Her dream is to acquire her own land. One challenge that she faces in her work is fighting pests that can ruin her corn. One specific pest is known as langosta.

Luz spends her time working and being with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in her farming activities

loan.name: Lesbia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lesbia Del Carmen tiene 34 aos, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, actualmente se dedica a la compra venta de sal por quintal, tambin se dedica a la venta de lea pues se siente muy contenta de buscar el medio de vida. Ella realiza este negocio con apoyo de su esposo, el que la distribuye en un camin en otros departamentos del pas. Pues es con este nuevo financiamiento pretende comprar mayor cantidad de sal, lo cual le generara mayores ganancias y con esto seguir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar y darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Mantener este negocio es muy importante para ella, pues es la nica fuente de empleo para mantener el hogar.
texts.en:
Lesbia Del Carmen is 34 years old and has two children. She sells salt for the garden and firewood and is happy to be able to make a living this way. Her husband helps her with this work--he has a truck to deliver the goods to different parts of the country. With more financing, Lesbia and her husband hope to buy more salt so they can generate more income and thereby improve their home and make more space for their children. Keeping up this business is essential to them, since it is the only way they have to maintain their home.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy supplies

loan.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal El Nazareno inicia su sptimo ciclo con 13 socias que realizan diferentes actividades. Como es el caso D. la Seora Roco que es socia hace 2 aos y presidenta en este ciclo, lo que mas le agrada es la capacitacin Gals y lo esta poniendo en practica en su vida diaria. Roco es soltera , tiene 33 aos y 2 hijas, Roco venD. comida tpica como mondongo en la puerta D. su casa, actividad que realiza todos los das sbados y domingos. Adems Roco es profesora D. primaria y brinda asesoramiento particular a nios, tambin es cosmetloga y brinda servicios a domicilios como peinados y maquillajes. Roco necesita un prstamo D. 300 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra D. mesas y sillas. El sueo D. Roco es ampliar su negocio y tener un restaurante y que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
El Nazareno community bank began its 7th loan cycle with 13 members, who all have different business activities. Roco, a bank member for 2 years and president of her group this cycle, most enjoys the goals training which she puts into practice in her everyday life. Roco is 33 years old and a single mother of 2 girls. She sells traditional food such as mondongo (a hearty stew of tripe and vegetables) from her home all day on the weekends. She is also a primary school teacher, teaching children basic education, as well as a cosmetologist, providing at-home hair styling and makeover services. Roco needs a loan of 300 PEN to purchase tables and chairs. Her dream is to expand her business and start a restaurant. She hopes her daughters will have careers as educated professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of tables and chairs.

loan.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer esforzada, vive junto con su familia, el cual todo se apoyan para ayudar en su pequeo negocio una pulpera que ha venido administrando desde hace doce aos. Y que junto con Afodenic ha venido creciendo. Ya que cuando comenz era poco el inventario a travs de los financiamientos ha invertido en ropa, zapatos, cosmticos, y ms en granos bsicos ofreciendo al cliente Lo mejor. Sus productos los compra en el mercado a proveedores, para lograr mejor precio y dar a buen precio al cliente. Logrando a si mantener la clientela, lo que esta contenta ya que es su fuente de entrada para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos. Con este prstamo invertir en granos bsicos, golosinas, cajas de leche, caja de jabn, productos lcteos, ropa, zapatos, cosmticos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a resourceful woman who lives with her family: they all help her out with her activity, a small corner shop she has been running for twelve years, and which has been growing thanks to Afodenics support. She started with a small stock, and thanks to the loans she has managed to invest in clothes, shores, cosmetics and more basic grains, thus offering the best products to her customers. She buys her products in the wholesale market in order to obtain the best rates and so be able to offer fair prices that allow her to keep her customers, something she is happy about as this provides her with an income she can use to help her husband facing family expenses. This loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, sweets, milk cartons, bars of soap, dairy products, clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy different products for her corner shop.

loan.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria Jos, de 42 aos, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que ms desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que realiza todos los das en su negocio como es la venta de mercadera en general, le ha trado buenos resultados. Lo que ms le gusta de su trabajo es hablar con sus clientes de los diferentes productos que le solicitan, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos estn dando frutos, lleva ms de 6 aos realizando esta actividad y considera que lo ms difcil es superara la competencia. Este es el primer crdito, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas con esto comprara calzado, perfumes, cremas y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Maria Jos is 42 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman, living in a house that she owns and whose biggest dream is to improve the quality of her life. She has obtained very good results from the hard work she does every day in her shop, where she sells various goods. What she likes the most about her job is talking to her customers about the different products they ask for, because then its when she feels her efforts are giving the best results. She has been running this activity for more than 6 years, and she considers facing competition to be the most difficult part. This is her first loan: she knows she has to make great efforts and work very hard to punctually repay her dues; the loan will be used to buy shoes, perfumes, creams and items of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase her working capital.

loan.name: Bernardo

texts.es: El seor Bernardo cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes y papelera, llamado Papelera L. el y su esposa tienen poco con el negocio, pero quieren que sea una tienda mas grande y con mas mercanca, ya que es la nica fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan, son una pareja joven y todava no tienen hijos, pero quieren tener una estabilidad econmica para cuando los tengan. El seor Bernardo requiere de este crdito para invertir en el negocio de la tienda, surtiendo mas abarrotes y as aumentar su clientela y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Seor Bernardo runs a grocery store and stationary shop called Papelera L.. He and his wife have little in their shop, but they would like to have a larger store with more merchandise, since it is their only source of income. They are a young couple that don't have any children yet, but they would like to be financially stable when they do have them. Seor Bernardo will use the loan that he is requesting to buy more groceries to stock his store and thereby, increase his clientele and his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase more groceries to stock his store

loan.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides es un padre de familia de 38 aos de edad, tiene un hijo y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Mrrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su poblacin concentrada en zonas rurales dispersas alrededor de su pueblo central, que es el lugar donde se concentra todo la actividad comercial del distrito.
Desde hace nueve aos se dedica a la crianza y comercializacin de aves de corral en su domicilio, el suele criar patos, los compra pequeos para luego engordarlos y cuando alcanzan un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que frecuentan el lugar donde vive. Este negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento econmico de su familia.
Aristides desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas pastos y alimento balanceado para lograr que estos se desarrollen de buena manera y percibir mayores ingresos al momento de su venta. Para lograr este objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles. Al realizar esta accin el podr cubrir la demanda con la que cuenta ya que actualmente cuenta con varios pedidos por cumplir.
Arstides es una persona trabajadora y bastante responsable, en la zona donde vive sus conocidos le consideran alguien tranquilo y honrado. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucin y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Aristides is a 38 year old father with one child. He lives with his family in the Mrrope district, a district characterized as having the majority of its population concentrated in scattered, rural areas around a central village. This is where all the commercial activity in the district takes place. Nine years ago he started raising and selling poultry, mostly ducks, from home. He buys them young and fattens them up and when they have grown to a good size, he sells them to his neighbors and the dealers that frequent the area where he lives. This business allows him to cover his personal expenses and to support his family. Aristides wants to expand his business by buying more ducks and also, feed that will provide them with a balanced diet so that they are healthy and he can get a better price when he sells them. In order to achieve this goal he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). This will help him to meet the demand since he currently has several orders to fill. Aristides is hard-working and quite responsible. In the region where he lives he is known for being a peaceful and honest person. He has worked previously with our organization and has been punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase poultry to raise and sell and feed to expand his business

loan.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Doa Dolores tiene la edad de 44 aos, madre de tres hijos, el cual tuvo que educar sola desde hace varios aos, ya que se separo de su esposo. No ha sido difcil pero nada imposible, junto a el y ha sus esfuerzo hicieron su casa. Trabaja como asistente administrativo para una fundacin, pues con su salario cubre las necesidades alimenticias, pero no alcanza para poder hacer las mejoras a su casa. Lo que le preocupa ya que en tiempo de invierno se le mete toda el agua por la calle ya que se inmunda debido a que los causes estn llenos de basura, tiene unas reglas lo que hace que el agua se desvi pero cuando la lluvia es fuerte la bota. La iniciativa para lograr esta mejora, es a travs del financiamiento ya que los pagos son mensuales, lo que le permite equilibrar su dinero. Para esta mejora comprara: piedra, cemento, arena, piedrin para hacer un pequeo muro, el cual ya pidi permiso a la alcalda, y as lograr poder cerrar el desage. Y poder estar en mejores condiciones higinica
texts.en:
Dona Dolores, 44, is the mother of three children. She had to raise the children alone for many years after she separated from her husband. It was difficult but she managed and, thanks to his efforts and hers, they built a house. Dona Dolores works as an administrative assistant for a foundation. Although her income from the job covers her everyday expenses, it's not enough for her to be able to improve the house. Dona Dolores worries that the house will be flooded in the winter because the streets are full of trash and water from the rains backs up in the streets and floods the area. She has some "reglas" (some kind of barrier, presumably) to divert the water away but when the rains are heavy, the reglas are not enough to stop the water. Dona Dolores can manage the improvements she wants to make with a loan because she can include the monthly payments in her budget. To make the improvements, she will buy stone, cement and sand to build a small wall--a project for which she already has approval from the city--and, consequently, stop the flooding. The project will improve the sanitary conditions of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy construction materials to build flood wall.

loan.name: Felipa

texts.es: La seora Felipa se dedica a las labores del hogar, su esposo el seor Jos Margarito trabaja como obrero en una maquiladora. Tienen 3 hijos pequeos y una hija grande que tambin trabaja como obrera en una maquiladora, ella contribuye en los gastos de la casa. Sus tres hijos pequeos estn en la escuela y la Seora Felipa necesita comprar los tiles Escolares y Uniformes para los tres nios, es por eso que ella pide el apoyo de ustedes, para poder solventar estos gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Felipa is a housewife and her husband, Sr. Jose Margarito, works in a "maquiladora" (a factory in a free-trade zone). They have four children: three school-aged children and one grown daughter who also works in a maquiladora. The oldest daughter contributes to the family budget. The three younger children are in school and Sra. Felipa needs to buy school supplies and uniforms for them. It's for this purpose that she is asking for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy school supplies and uniforms.

loan.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro es una mujer de 42 aos de edad, comerciante de una pequea pulpera que ha venido invirtiendo con dinero propio pues no es el primer financiamiento por lo que con ellos ha podido salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Pues ha logrado mantener estable su negocio, solo que algunas veces no tiene el capital para seguir invirtiendo, por lo que con el tiempo y la experiencia han sido los factores fundamentales para continuar. Con este prstamo invertir en granos bsicos, que es el alimento principal, lcteos, carne, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcia Del Socorro, 42, operates a small corner shop which she has developed, in part, with her own money. However, this isn't her first loan and she has used past loans to get ahead and improve the quality of her life. Although she has managed to stablilize her business, there are times when she doesn't have enough to cover her operational expenses and she has to rely on time and experience to go on. She will use this loan to buy the products she sells: staple grains, dairy products, meat, candy, cold drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital.

loan.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El seor Luis Alberto es Albail, tiene tres hijos pequeos. Quiere ir mejorando su calidad de vida; es por ello que ha ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco para ofrecer a su familia comodidad y un buen patrimonio para el futuro. El seor quiere poner la losa de concreto en un cuarto que tiene en la parte trasera de su vivienda. El Seor Luis Alberto les agradece la ayuda para realizar su Proyecto de su Vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a bricklayer. He has three small children. He wants to improve his quality of life. Little by little he has been building his house in order to make his family comfortable and to give them a good inheritance in the future. He wants to pour a concrete slab in a room in the back of his house. Luis Alberto is grateful for the help on his home project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Concrete slab

loan.name: Hosanna Jabneel

texts.es: Hosanna es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, tiene un hijo pequeo de dos aos y vive sola con el ya que desde hace un tiempo vive separada de su esposo. Ella se preocupa por el bienestar de ella y de su bebe, es por eso que esta solicitando este crdito, por que quiere colocar una barda en la parte del frente de la vivienda, para ofrecerle a su hijo un patrimonio seguro. Y tambin para sentirse ella misma mas tranquila cuando esta sola con su hijo.
texts.en:
Hosanna is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She lives alone with her small two year old son. She has been separated from her husband for some time. She worries about her well-being and that of her baby. That is why she is requesting this loan. She wants to place a wall in the front part of her house. She wants to do this to give her son a secure inheritance. She also wants to feel that she is not worried when she is alone with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Build a wall

loan.name: Bimala

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Bimala N.. She is married and has four children, aged 14, 10, 8 and 3. In five years, she established her shop business, and working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.
Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. Bimala has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and is using her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her shop.
In the future, Bimala plans to continue her business. She thanks you for your support.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates on the BPW Partner Page.
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loan.use: increase the inventory in her shop

loan.name: Ana Guadalupe Esmeralda

texts.es: La Seora Ana Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora, que le gusta siempre ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como profesor en una escuela primaria y ella vende nieve y comida rpida. Ella requiere de este crdito para invertir al negocio, y as obtener mayores ganancias y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija pequea.
texts.en:
Ana Guadalupe is a hard-working woman who always likes to help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works as a teacher in an elementary school. She sells ice-cream and fast food. She needs this loan to invest in her business. That way she will get more income and be able to give her little daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in her business

loan.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: Silvia tiene 28 aos D. edad, es soltera, actualmente asume el cargo D. tesorera D. la alcanca comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO. Trabajan con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad, desD. hace 5 aos y medio, su alcanca comunal est conformada por 10 socios y se encuentra ubicada en El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, los socios realizan actividades como comercio y servicio. Silvia se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa por temporada como ambulante desD. hace 6 meses, se inicio a raz que su familia la anim y apoyo para implementar su pequeo negocio, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo solo logra ahorrar lo poco que gana para poder invertirlo en su negocio. El gran sueo D. Silvia es tener un negocio propio D. ropas interiores y joyas. El reciente prstamo ser utilizado para la construccin D. su vivienda, todos los participantes D. la alcanca estn muy contentos y agradecidos por la ayuda que se les brinda. (Nios en la foto hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old, single, and has become treasurer of the Mara Elena Moyano communal bank. This bank has worked with EDAPROSPO Prosperidad (Prosperity) for 5 years. The bank is composed of 10 members and is located in El Agustino, department of Lima. All the members carry out activities relating to commerce and services. Silvia has bought and sold seasonal clothing in the streets for the last 6 months. She began because her family encouraged and helped her to start her small business. By means of her work alone, she saved the little that she earned to be able to invest in her business. Silvia's grand dream is to have a business selling underwear and jewelry. This recent loan will be used to construct her house. All the participants in the communal bank are very content and grateful for the help they are offered. (The children in the photo belong to the members.)

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: CONSTRUCTING HER HOUSE

loan.name: Placida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA; La socia vive en el distrito D. San Jernimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Placida; ella tiene 57 aos D. edad y la socia es casada ella estudi la secundaria incompleta debido a la falta D. dinero que padeci en su hogar ella desD. muy chica se dedic a trabajar para ayudar a hermanos menores; La socia venD. pasto y tambin jora que es uno D. los principales ingredientes para elaborar la chicha D. jora. (maz amarillo macerado). La socia venD. la jora por las maanas y entrando las 5 D. la tarD. ella sale a vender en la puerta D. su casa pasto, estos das ala socia estuvo vendiendo su pasto en la puerta D. la casa D. su vecina delante D. una tienda, ella es una mujer muy alegre y con muchas ganas D. progresar en la vida, La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar maz amarillo y elaborar la jora para la venta D. chicha.
La socia valora y agradece el crdito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad D. vida, as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank "Seor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla"; She lives in the San Jernimo district of Chimpahuayylla in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Mrs. Placida; she's 57-years-old and married. She didn't finish high school due to the lack of money in her household. Since she was very young she's worked to help her younger siblings. She sells grass and jora (yellow maize), which is one of the principal ingredients in making chicha D. jora (a fermented corn beverage popular in Peru). She sells the jora in the mornings and at 5:00 p.m. she starts selling grass from her home. These days she sells grass from her neighbor's house in front of a store. She's a very happy woman with ambition to progress in life. She's asking for the loan to buy yellow maize to sell chicha. She's very grateful for this loan because it permits her to grow her business and have a better quality of life; she promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of yellow maize to make chicha

loan.name: Betty Yliana

texts.es:
Betty es una madre D. familia D. 44 aos D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijas en el distrito D. Pueblo Nuevo, un distrito perteneciente a L. provincia D. Chepn ubicada en L. regin L. Libertad, a mas D. una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.
Se dedica a L. venta D. artculos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en L. casa donD. vive, elL. ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. productos D. uso diario que usualmente son D. difcil acceso por lo que su negocio siempre cuenta con acogida D. parte D. sus clientes. Esta actividad es importante para su familia porque gracias a elL. Betty pueD. ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.
Betty necesita ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. mas productos D. modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo L. demanda D. sus clientes, por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito D. 2000 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro D. su objetivo.
ElL. es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, elL. se esfuerza constantemente para salir adelante ya que desea ver a su familia progresar. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institucin y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Betty, age 44, lives with her husband and their three daughters in the Pueblo Nuevo district. This district belongs to the Chepn province in the L. Libertad region. It is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells basic needs products and groceries in a store set up in her home. She sells all types of products for daily use, which are usually difficult to get. That is why her business is always well-received by her customers. This activity is important for her family. Thanks to the business, Betty is able to help her husband cover the family expenses. Betty needs to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can continue to satisfy her customer demand. That is why she is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will contribute to achieving her objective. She is a hard-working woman who is very devoted to her family. She constantly strives to get ahead because she wants to see her family make progress. She has worked with our institution previously, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility about making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy basic needs products and groceries to expand the store in her house

loan.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 51 aos. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que dependen de ella. Su actividad es la elaboracin de cepillos, pastes de bao. Por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy emprendedora. Pues tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundacin. Este financiamiento que est realizando es para la compra de materia prima como hilo, esponja, telas, cloro y lea entre otras cosas. El sueo que siempre le gustara cumplir es establecer un taller en donde pueda ofrecer trabajo a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 51 and has 3 dependent children. She makes brushes and washcloths. Rosa has always been very industrious and she has worked with the Foundation for a long time. This loan will be used to buy basic supplies such as thread, sponges, fabric, bleach and firewood, etc. The dream that she always has had is to set up a shop where she can offer employment to people who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jernimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucia; ella tiene 34 aos de edad y la socia es madre soltera y tiene 1 hija, ella tiene estudios superiores de enfermera, la socia trabaja cuidando ancianos, ella est ahora cuidando a una anciana que est enferma en casa, la socia en sus ratos libres se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa de forma ambulante, ella vende a sus amigas y gente conocida. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor y vender.
La socia valora y agradece el crdito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA communal bank. She lives in the district of San Jernimo en Chimpahuaylla, the province and department of Cusco. Lucia is a 34 year old single mother with one daughter. She studied nursing at the university level and works as a caregiver for the elderly. She is currently caring for an elderly woman who is sick at home. In her spare time, she has a business in which she works as a street vendor, selling clothing. She sells to her friends and people she knows. She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale clothing for resale. Lucia is grateful for the loan as it will allow her to grow her business and have a better quality of life. In addition, she promises to make her payments according to the agreed upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy wholesale clothing for resale

loan.name: Makhamali

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Makhamali L.. She is married and has three children aged 14, 12 and 5. In 2010, she established her vegetable selling business. Working five days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her store. In the future, Makhamali plans to continue and increase her business. She thanks you for your support.
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh vegetables are purchased from the local farmers and sold. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.
For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loan.use: to purchase vegetables for selling

loan.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jernimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Noemi; ella tiene 35 aos de edad y la socia es madre soltera, su pareja la abandon por otra mujer, ella tienen 2 hijos y desde entonces es madre y padre para sus dos pequeos hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus dos trabajos, ella trabaja en una fbrica de lcteos en el distrito de Oropesa situado a 20 minutos de su barrio; La socia tambin se dedica a vender granos secos para la venta los fines de semana en el mercado vino canchn, ella vende (maz de diferentes variedades, pallares, cereales, frijoles, lentejas, entre otros productos secos.), La socia desea juntar dinero para los estudios de sus hijos y darles a ellos una mejor calidad de vida, ella tambin quiere comprar muebles y mejorar su casita; La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar productos secos.
La socia valora y agradece el crdito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Noemi belongs to the Seor de los Miagros de Chimpahuaylla Communal Bank, and lives in the San Jernimo district of Chimpahuaylla province, Cusco district. She is 35 years old and a single mother, her partner having abandoned her for another woman. Noemi has 2 children and since being abandoned, has been mother and father to them both. She alternates her household activities with working in a dairy plant in the Oropesa distract, some 20 minutes from her barrio. Noemi also sells dry grains on weekends in the Vino Canchn Market. She sells different varieties of corn, and harvests of cereals, beans, and lentils, among other dry products. Noemi wants to accumulate money for her children's studies and to provide them with a better quality of life. She also wishes to buy furniture and improve her little house. Noemi is soliciting a loan to buy dry grains to sell. She values and appreciates the offered loan, since it will permit her to grow and have a better quality of life, and she promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: BUYING DRY GRAINS TO SELL

loan.name: Las Flores De Fortin Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Inocencia M., un integrante del grupo Las Flores de Fortn, que est ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en Mxico. Se ve la entrada de la casa en donde se ubica la papelera de la seora Inocencia en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de artculos de papelera y regalos que inici hace 3 aos. Solicita el prstamo para pagar mercanca que ya encarg pues se acerca la entrada a clases y tiene que estar bien surtida . Sus clientes la ven como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Su papelera se ubica cerca de dos escuelas que son las que lo mantienen rentable . Al momento de solicitar este prstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que se acerca una buena temporada de ventas. Tiene 58 aos, estudio hasta el 6 ao de primaria, vive en unin libre y tiene en total 4 hijos 3 mujeres y 1 varones. Quiere este crdito para pagar mercanca que ya pidi como libretas cuadernos plastilina y regalos Tambin espera el negocio le pueda ayudar a mejorar su vida y de esta forma apoyar a su hija con la crianza de sus nietos. Salome A. es la presidenta del grupo Las Flores de Fortn estudi hasta el tercer ao de preparatoria y tiene en total 1 hija. Ella se dedica a venta de lencera que inici hace 2 aos. Solicita el prstamo para iniciar la venta de pasteles. El grupo esta conformado por 12 de integrantes. Los otros integrantes son: Yasmn S.(venta de verdura), Petra M.(venta de antojitos), Gladis M.(venta de comida), Mara Basilisa M. (venta de gorditas), Marcela Natalia A. (venta de cloro), Camerina L. (venta de pan), Matilde L. (venta de cosmticos), Concepcin M. (bordados y tejidos), Gloria E. (Papelera) y Yuly Vianey E. (Renta de cuatrimotos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Inocencia M.s house. She is a member of the Las Flores de Fortn (The Flowers of Fortn) group, which is located in the state of Veracruz, Mexico. You can see her in the entrance to her house, which is where her stationery store is located. She has been selling stationery products and gifts for three years. She is requesting the loan to pay for merchandise she ordered. School will soon be starting, and she has to be well stocked. Her customers see her as a responsible and hard-working person. Her stationery store is located close to two schools, and they keep her business profitable. She is enthusiastic about requesting the loan because the season for good sales is approaching. She is 58 years old, and she has a sixth grade education. She is in a common-law marriage; and she has four children, three girls and a boy. She wants this loan to pay for merchandise that she has already requested. She will buy things like notebooks, folders, clay, and gifts. She also hopes that the business will be able to help her improve her life. That way she can help her daughter raise her grandchildren. Salome A. is the president of the Las Flores de Fortn group. She went to school until her third year of high school. She has one daughter. She has been selling lingerie for two years. She is requesting a loan to start selling pastries. The group is comprised of 12 members. The other members are: Petra M.(sells snacks), Gladis M.(sells food), Mara Basilisa M. (sells gorditas, which are small, thick, corn flour tortillas), Marcela Natalia A. (sells bleach), Camerina L. (sells bread), Matilde L. (sells cosmetics), Concepcin M. (embroidery and weavings), Gloria E. (stationery store), and Yuly Vianey E. (rents four wheel drive ATV)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To pay for merchandise

loan.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Don Francisco de 37 aos d edad, viven con su esposa y sus hijos menores de edad que son tres y los tiene estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. Don francisco tiene su propio negocio taller de zapatos, desde hace 17 aos el elabora sus zapatos para caballeros y nios de todo estilo y tipo. Su producto es de calidad y buscado por mayoristas y minorista por su comodidad, estilo y precio. Ha tenido dificultades de que algunos clientes no le pagan al tiempo estipulado. Lo inicio con pocas cantidades de pedido lo cuales con el tiempo han aumentado, siempre ha trabajado en su taller solo que fue ms pequeo que ahora. Con este crdito comprara materia prima, ya que desea seguir aumentado la produccin en mercadera como cuero, hilo, nylon pega de zapato, tinta, entre otras para lograr hacer sus estilo de zapatos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 37-years-old, lives with his wife and three young children who study at the local school. For 17 years Francisco has had his own shoe-making shop specializing in shoes of many types for men and children. He produces a quality product that is sought out by wholesalers and retailers for its comfort, style, and price. He's had difficulties with some customers failing to pay him on time. He began his business with few orders, but over time demand has increased. He's always worked in his workshop--the only difference is that it used to be smaller. With this loan he will by raw materials such as leather, thread, nylon, shoe glue, and dye because he wants to continue expanding production of merchandise and make his particular style of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of raw materials such as leather, nylon, and glue to increase his production of shoes

loan.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Nirmala B.. She is married and has four children, aged 11, 7, 6 and 2. In 2010, she established her business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her store. In the future, Nirmala plans to continue and increase her grocery business. She thanks you for your support.
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.
For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loan.use: increase the inventory in her shop

loan.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jernimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Mariluz; ella tiene 28 aos de edad y la socia es madre soltera ella tiene 1 hijo y es padre y madre para su menor hijito, ella es la nica encargada de proveerle a su menor hijo el abrigo, alimento y todo tipo de cuidados y necesidades el se requiera en el desarrollo de su menor hijo; La socia tiene dos trabajos en los que juntando los dos sueldos llega hacer el bsico vital para sustentarse, La socia trabaja haciendo la limpieza en un hostal en la calle Huscar y independientemente ella tambin compra artesanas para la venta los fines de semana en la plaza de Tpac Amaru, La socia se mantiene muy ocupada con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su menor hijo. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar artesana y continuar ayudndose con este otro negocio.
La socia valora y agradece el crdito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA; she lives in the district of San Jernimo in Chimpahuaylla in the province and department of Cusco. Mariluz is 28-years-old and the single mother of 1 child. She's father and mother for her little child; she's the only one responsible for providing shelter, food, and all the basic necessities for raising a child. Between the wages from two jobs she manages to make enough to support herself. She works as a cleaning woman in a hostel on Huscar street, and as an independent retailer of handicrafts on the weekend in the Tpac Amaru plaza. She stays very busy trying to improve her quality of life for herself and her child. She's asking for this loan to buy handicrafts so that she can continue supporting herself with this side business. She's very grateful for the loan because it will help her grow her business and achieve a better quality of life. She promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of handicrafts

loan.name: Acuario Group

texts.es: La Sra. Proselita socia entusiasta y emprendedora, tiene 59 aos D. edad, conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que son el motivo D. su vida, su domicilio est ubicado en la urb. Sol D. Vitarte Ate, departamento D. Lima. Actualmente ocupa el cargo D. Tesorera D. la alcanca comunal ACUARIO la cual est conformado por 7 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades: venta D. productos D. belleza, wawa wasi, a la venta D. ropas y otros, la alcanca comunal trabaja con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad desD. hace 8 meses. Proselita se dedica a la venta D. bebidas (gaseosas, cerveza), tiene 59 aos en este negocio, ella se inicio en un mercado llamado SOL D. VITARTE, logro tener un ahorro y poner el negocio en su vivienda, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo logro terminar la construccin D. su vivienda y apoyar en los estudios D. su hija quien estudia en una universidad particular, ya que el gran anhelo D. Proselita es que su hija obtenga su ttulo profesional y que sus hijos tengan una vivienda donD. vivir. Con el prstamo obtenido realizara la compra D. mercadera para implementar su negocio, todos nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos por el apoyo a la micro empresa y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos en los plazos pactados. (Nios en la foto hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
Proselita is an enthusiastic and enterprising partner. She's 59-years-old, lives with a common-law husband, and has 4 children who are her motivation in life. Her house is located in Sol D. Vitarte in the department of Lima. Currently she acts as treasurer in the communal bank "ACUARIO," which is composed of 7 partners who perform various activities: sale of beauty products, wawa wasi (young child care in Peru), clothing sales, and others. The communal bank has worked with EDARPROSPO-Prosperity for 8 months. Proselita has sold drinks (sodas, beer) for 59 years. She began in a market called "SOL D. VITARTE," where she saved up enough money to move her business to her home. With much hard work she finished the construction of her home and helped support her daughter, who studies in a private university. Proselita's greatest hope is that her daughter obtains her professional degree and that her sons have a place to live. With this loan she will buy merchandise to expand her business. All of our partners are very grateful for the support of the micro-company and they promise to make their payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jernimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 51 aos de edad y la socia es viuda y ella tiene 4 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene su peculiar carrito en el cual incorpor sus ollas y los mantiene calientitos con esas mantas gruesas que envuelven las ollas; ell lleva a vender al mercado vino canchn y sus diferentes platos de comida, ella es una excelente cocinera por lo que su arte le ha valido para mantenerse toda la vida con sus negocio de comidas, pero La socia ha comprado unas ovejitas tiernas y ahora que crecieron ella las vende tambin en el mercado, este negocio le est ayudando a nmejorar su economa y est pensando en adquirir unos cuantos ovinos. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar sus comiditas y comprar gas.
La socia valora y agradece el crdito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA; she lives in the district of San Jernimo in Chimpahuaylla in the province and department of Cusco. Hilda is 51-years-old. She's a widow with 4 children. She alternates domestic duties with commercial retail. She has her own cart that holds her pots that she keeps warm with thick blankets. She brings her cart to the Vino Canchn market to sell various dishes. She's an excellent cook, and this art has maintained her all her life in her food business. She's also bought some young sheep and now that they're grown she sells them in the market. This business is helping her improve her finances and she's thinking about acquiring a few more sheep. She's asking for the loan to buy supplies for her food and to buy gas. She's grateful for the loan because it will permit her to grow her business and have a better quality of life. She promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of supplies to make food

loan.name: Marling Norelly

texts.es: Mailing Norelly tiene la edad de 24 aos, Ella se dedica a la actividad econmica como es el la venta de mercadera en general. Hace ms de 6 aos que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella pagaba por la ropa que compraba era el doble as descubri que este negocio es muy rentable, por lo que ya tiene experiencia en financiamiento. El negocio al principio fue difcil porque no tena capital, suficientes su primer prstamo lo invirti para comprar algunas prendas como camisas, pantalones y blusas, la ubicacin de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar una gran variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Marling Norelly is 24-years-old. For over 6 years she's sold merchandise general merchandise. When she first paid for her clothes she realized that they were marked up to double their value, and that retail was a profitable business, especially because she already had finance experience. The business was difficult at first because she didn't have sufficient capital. She invested her first loan in the purchase of garments such as shirts, pants, and blouses. Her business is located in her modest home. She's asking for this loan to purchase a great variety of garments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jernimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 35 aos de edad y la socia es casada y tiene 2 menores hijos, ella tiene su stand en el mercado vino canchn ella vende granos secos (todas las variedades de maz, frijoles, lentejas, porotos, pallares, moraya y otros) La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y compra al por mayor las semillas para luego venderlos en su stand, La socia ayuda en la educacin de la familia. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor.
La socia valora y agradece el crdito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, as mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the SEOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA ["Lord of the Miracles of Chimpahuaylla"] communal bank. She lives in Chimpahuaylla, in the district of San Jernimo and the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Isabel, and she is 35 years old and married with 2 young children. She has a stand in the Vino Canchn market where she sells dry grains and beans (all of the varieties of corn, lentils, red beans, white beans, lima beans, moraya [dried potatoes], etc.). She is a very hard-working woman, and she buys her products wholesale to sell from her stand. She is helping pay for her children's education. Isabel is requesting this loan to buy dry products on a wholesale basis. Isabel values and appreciates the loan offered to her, since it will permit her to make progress and to have a better quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying dry products on a wholesale basis

loan.name: Santa Lucia New Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Rosalina V. , integrante del grupo Santa Luca New, que est ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en Mxico. Se ve al fondo de la foto el negocio de florera y bisutera de la seora Rosalina. Ella se dedica a la venta de anturios y artculos de bisutera, papelera y regalos que inicio hace 6 aos. Solicita el prstamo para invertir en su negocio y meterle un poco de abarrotes para darle ms variedad a su negocio. Sus clientes la consideran una persona muy trabajadora. El negocio se ubica en la parte de enfrente de su casa. Al momento de solicitar este prstamo se siente muy contenta porque podr hacerlo crecer un poco. Tiene 64 aos, estudi hasta el 6to. ao de primaria, vive unin libre y tiene en total 3 hijos ( 1 mujer y 2 varones). Quiere este crdito para invertir en ms mercanca y comprar abarrotes para tenerlo ms surtido. Tambin espera mejorar sus ingresos para poder ampliar su casa y construir un techo ms resistente ya que cuando hay suradas o viento fuerte, el techo que es de lmina actualmente se ha cado en varias ocasiones. Ana Laura L. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 29 aos, estudi hasta el 3er. ao de Secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de artculos de papelera que inici hace 7 aos. Solicita el prstamo para comprar papelera para seguir vendiendo. El grupo esta conformado por 11 de integrantes quienes son: Anselma H. (venta de calzado,) Eufrosina S. (venta de abarrotes), Mara Luisa H. (venta de abarrotes), Roco M. (venta de calzado), Araceli P. (Venta de Comida), Margarita N. (venta de abarrotes), Mnica D. (venta de ropa), Lourdes O. (venta de antojitos), Mara Guadalupe O. (venta de antojitos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Rosalina V., member of the SANTA LUCIA NEW Group which is located in Veracruz, Mexico. At the bottom of the photo, you can see Ms. Rosalinas flower and costume jewelry shop. For the past 6 years, she has been selling anthuriums, costume jewelry, stationery, and gifts. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and plans to add some groceries to her inventory in order to offer more variety. Her customers regard her as a very hard-worker. The business is located in the front part of her home. When applying for this loan, she felt very happy because she knew she would be able to make her business grow a bit. She is 64 years old, studied up to the 6th year of primary school, lives in a common-law relationship and has 3 children (one daughter and two sons). She wants this loan to invest in more merchandise and buy groceries so that her shop will be better stocked. In addition, she hopes to increase her income in order to be able to expand her house and build a more weather resistant roof as the laminate roof she has at present has fallen on numerous occasions during the suradas (strong South winds). . Ana Laura L. is president of the group. She is 29 years old, studied up to the 3rd year of secondary school, is married and has 2 sons. She has been selling stationery for the past 7 years. She is requesting this loan to buy stationery in order to maintain sales. The group is made up of the following 11 members: Anselma H. (footwear sales) Eufrosina S. (grocery sales) Mara Luisa H. (grocery sales) Roco M. (footwear sales) Araceli P. (food sales) Margarita N. (grocery sales) Mnica D. (clothing sales) Lourdes O. (snack sales) Mara Guadalupe O. (snack sales)

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase stationery in order to maintain sales

loan.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo es un padre de familia de 35 aos de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el casero Sebastopol del distrito agrcola de Pacanga, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Chepn de la regin La Libertad, ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura y al comercio desde que era mas joven, el cuenta con algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen entre sus vecinos. Adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeo terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar alfalfa, la cual comercializa diariamente en el mercado de Pacanguilla (un pueblo cercano), con esta actividad el solventa los gastos de su familia por lo que siempre trata de esforzarse para salir adelante .
Arnaldo desea mejorar su negocio de ganadera comprando alimento balanceado para alimentar a sus vacas, esta accin le permitir obtener mayores ingresos ya que la produccin mejorar en cantidad y calidad, para lograr su objetivo ha credo conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles.
Arnaldo siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, por ello trabaja sin cesar. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is a 35-year-old father who lives with his wife and child in the settlement of Sebastopol in the agricultural district of Pacanga, which belongs to Chepn province in La Libertad region and lies more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has dedicated himself to work related to agriculture and trade since he was a young man. He has several head of cattle, and he sells the milk they produce to his neighbors. He also has a small plot of farmland where he usually plants alfalfa, which he sells each day at the market in Pacanguilla (a nearby village). With this activity, he is able to cover his family's expenses, and he is always trying to put forth extra effort to get ahead. Arnaldo wants to improve his cattle business by purchasing nutritionally balanced feed for his cows. This initiative will help him earn a better income, since the cows' production will improve in both quality and quantity. To achieve his objective, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. Arnaldo is always working hard to help his family get ahead; he works unceasingly for this purpose. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him consider him an honest and hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying balanced feed to improve his dairy cows' production

loan.name: Lourdes Del Socorro

texts.es: Lourdes es mujer esforzada, madre de tres hijos, comerciante desde hace catorce aos en donde ha venido aumentando el nivel de ventas. Cuando inicio lo hizo con poca mercadera y gracias a su tenacidad ha venido incrementando su pequea pulpera, por aos. A si mismo Hoy en da tiene poco inventario ya que ha estado un poco mal de salud, y gastado mucho en medicamento, con ayuda de su esposo ha salido a delante ya que tambin el trabaja como pequeo comerciante en la venta de carne de res. Tambin a travs del apoyo con los financiamientos de Afodenic ha logrado incrementar y equilibrar sus ventas ya que es su cuarto crdito que ha venido pagando mensualmente. Lo que le permite poder cumplir con su pago y pagar tambin sus gastos bsicos. Con este prstamo comprara: granos bsicos, lcteos, golosinas, gaseosa, productos enlatados y otros logrando poder aumentar el inventario y vender mas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a hard-working woman and the mother of three children. She has been a businesswoman for fourteen years, during which she has gradually increased her sales volume. When she began, she had only a little merchandise, but thanks to her tenacity, she has gradually expanded her little food store over the years. Currently, she is low on inventory, because she has suffered a few health problems and has spent a lot of money on medicines. With her husband's help, she has gotten through this situation, since he also works as a small businessman, selling beef. Also through the support of loans from Afodenic she has been able to increase and stabilize her sales. This is her fourth loan, and she has been making monthly payments. This permits her to make her payments while also covering her basic expenses. With this loan, she will buy basic grains, dairy products, snacks, soft drinks, canned goods and other items, so that she can increase her inventory and sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, dairy products and other items to increase her sales

loan.name: Gaudencio

texts.en:
Gaudencio is a humble and hardworking family-oriented businessman. He has over ten years of experience as a salesman and two years ago opened his own business. His storefront business sells CDs, records, clothing, and gifts. Gaudencios wife and one of his sisters help him run the store. His business attracts the growing Latino population in his community.
One of Gaudencios greatest challenges is that he doesnt always have the goods that his customers are looking for. With his second ACCION USA loan, Gaudencio will be able to diversify his inventory by purchasing more clothing and Mexican accessories. This will allow him to retain more customers who come into his store looking for specific items.
Gaudencio has enjoyed being his own boss and generating extra income for his family. He felt the hardships of the economic crisis when no bank would lend to him. Receiving a loan from ACCION USA has allowed him to maintain his business and support his family. Gaudencio hopes to continue growing his business so that his family will be well off some day.
About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA
Have you ever thought about how the cute new caf on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current credit crisis. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these unbanked small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.
Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loan.use: Additional inventory, including clothing and Mexican accessories

loan.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa moved to the United States from Ecuador in 1999 with her family. In Ecuador she received her degree in Business Administration and practiced in the field for 25 years. When she moved to the United States, she didnt speak English very well, so she wasnt able to get a job in her field. In 1999, just months after moving to Boston, she started her own day care.
Starting her own business has allowed Teresa to provide an additional income for her family. She enjoys working with the children and owning her own business. The income generated from her day care also allowed her family to purchase the house in which they are living.
Teresas greatest challenge is the summer months. Between June and August many families take their children out of the day care for vacation and summer camps. During these months, Teresa has a hard time maintaining her cash flow and paying her three employees. Another challenge has been that many parents took their children out of day care during the economic crisis. Many decided to take care of their children at home instead of paying for her services.
This is Teresas 2nd loan with ACCION USA, with which shell be better able to maintain her business and pay employees during the summer months. She hopes to be better prepared for low attendance next summer, so that she doesnt run into this problem again. She knows that come September she will be back up to capacity in her day care. Teresas day care is well known in the greater Boston area and she receives many new clients through referrals.
About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA Have you ever thought about how the cute new caf on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current credit crisis. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these unbanked small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.
Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loan.use: To maintain cash flows & employees during slower summer months

loan.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan tiene la edad de 41 aos, comerciante de una miscelnea muy surtida que gracias a mucho esfuerzos y con crditos que Afodenic a otorgado durante un periodo de diez ciclos, por medios de sus prstamo logro la inversin. Ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con poco capital, propio producto de sus venta de fritanga, y de carpintera que hace aos era su oficio. Las dificultades que tiene es cuando se va la luz, ya que hay productos que se friegan rpido y es una perdida para el. Sus productos los compra a proveedores para lograr comprar ms barato y poder dar a mejor precio a sus clientes.
