loan.name: Tissiri 2 Group

texts.fr: Maris majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygamiques, les sept membres du groupe Tissiri 2 ont en moyenne 29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans le village de Siradjankoro dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la rgion de Sgou (4me rgion administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parent. Dans le but d'augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours Soro Yiriwaso et sont leur 1ier cycle de prt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver le mil, larachide, le ssame et le fonio. Madame Minata Traor compte utiliser son prt pour acheter 25kg de semences darachide, recruter la main duvre pour les activits de labour, de dsherbage et de rcolte dans ses diffrentes parcelles de culture. Elle se ravitaille en semences agricoles la foire Cinzana Gare et en main duvre avec lassociation des jeunes et des femmes du village. Avec une superficie de 1,50hectare, Madame Minata Traor compte produire 20 sacs darachide et 7 sacs de fonio. Une partie de la production du fonio et darachide est auto consomme dans la famille ordinairement ou utilise lors des crmonies de mariage, baptme ou funrailles alors que le reste sera vendu pour satisfaire les besoins du foyer en condiments, soins de sant des enfants et autres. Madame Minata Traor limage des autres femmes a pour objectif dassurer lauto suffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
Predominantly married in large polygamous families, the seven members of the group Tissiri 2 are on average 29 years old, have 2 children and all live in the village of Siradjankoro in the rural commune of Pelengana in the region of Sgou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through marital, neighborhood and parental ties. With the goal of increasing their cultivable land, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 1st farm loan. The members of the group are going to cultivate millet, peanuts, sesame and fonio (a type of millet produced in Mali). Mrs. Minata Traor expects to use her loan to buy 25 kg of peanut seeds and to recruit the manual labor for the labor, weeding, and harvesting in the different cultivated plots of land. She refreshes her supply of agricultural seeds at the fair in Cinzana Gare and gets her manual labor from an association of young people and women from the village. With 1.5 hectares of land, Mrs. Minata Traor expects to produce 20 bags of peanuts and 7 bags of fonio. A part of the fonio and peanuts produced is ordinarily consumed by the family itself or used during marriage ceremonies, baptism and funerals, while the rest will be sold to meet the needs of the household in condiments, the cares of their children's house, and other things. Mrs. Minata Traor like the other women of the group, has the objective of dietary self-sufficiency in the village.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy peanut seeds and to use manual labor for laboring, hoeing and harvesting.

loan.name: Djeneba

texts.fr: Madame Djeneba C. est ge de 47 ans, divorce et mre de 2 enfants. Elle vit chez elle mme dans une famille nuclaire au quartier Mdine de Sgou (quatrime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Secrtaire la douane de Sgou, paralllement cette activit, Djeneba mne des activits gnratrices de revenus, notamment le commerce de jus, quelle pratique depuis 35 ans. Elle a commenc auprs de sa mre qui vendait des jus lors des recrations aux abords des coles fondamentales. Sa force de vente est due la qualit de son jus, bien prpar et trs bien conserv. Pour faire son jus elle utilise 5 kilogrammes de sucre, 1kilogramme de gingembre, 2 kilogrammes de Tomi, 20 sachet de sucre vanilles et 4 sachets de poudre de jus (banane, mangue et orange). Le tout est mlang dans 1litre et deau afin davoir le got recherch, le breuvage mis dans des bidons soigneusement lavs seront dans le rfrigrateur pour refroidissement Dans le dessein daugmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de raliser plus de bnfice. Elle a fait recours Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernire depuis 12 mois. Aprs 1 prt individuel correctement bien rembours, elle est son 2me prt individuel quelle compte utiliser pour acheter 1 conglateur. Elle sapprovisionne sur place. Madame Djeneba C. vend au comptant et crdit une clientle compose de femmes et dhommes. Avec ce prt, elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bnfice lui permet de subvenir ses propres besoins et de participer aux vnements sociaux (baptme, mariage etc.).
texts.en:
Mrs. Djeneba C. is 47 years old, divorced and the mother of two children. She lives with her nuclear family in the Mdine district of Segou (the third administrative district of Mali). She is a secretary at the Sgou Customs office; parallel to that work, she also earns money through other business activities, mainly selling juice, which she has been doing for 35 years. She learned this trade from her mother, who used to sell juice by primary schools during recess. Her strong side is the high quality of her juice, well prepared and carefully conserved. II order to make her jjuice, she uses 5 kg [11 lbs] of sugar, 1 kg [2.2. lbs] of ginger, 2 kg [4.8 lbs] of tamarind, 20 packs of vanilla and 4 packs of powdered juice (banana, mango and orange). All ingredients are mixed in with 1.5 liter [about 1.6 qt] of water in order to achieve the desired taste. The beverage is then poured into cans which had been carefully washed and placed in the refrigerator to chill. In order to increase her working capital and earn a higher revenue, Mrs. C. has turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been a member for 12 months. After duly repaying her first individual loan, she is seeking a second loan in order to purchase a freezer. She stocks up locally. Mrs. Djeneba C. sells for cash and in credit to a customer base composed of both women and men. With this loan, she hopes to achieve a monthly income of 150,000 West African Francs. This will allow her to support herself and to take part in social event such as baptisms, weddings etc.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing a freezer

loan.name: Nytaa 1 Group

texts.fr: Les sept femmes du groupe Nytaa 1 sont toutes maries dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Balamissala dans la commune rurale de Sbougou dans la rgion de Sgou (4me rgion administrative du Mali) et se sont connues travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parent. Dans le but daugmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours Soro Yiriwaso et sont leur 2me cycle de prt de campagne. Le riz, le fonio et le gombo seront cultivs par les membres du groupe. Madame Korotoumou C. veut utiliser son prt pour acheter 25kg de semences de riz, deux sacs de complexe crale, 2 bidons dherbicide et recruter la main duvre pour les activits de labour, de repiquage et de sarclage dans ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles la foire de Sbougou, en main duvre avec lassociation des jeunes et des femmes du village. Avec une superficie de 3,1 hectares, elle espre produire 10 sacs de riz, 2 sacs de fonio et une trentaine de sac de gombo. Une partie de la production est auto consomme tandis que le reste est vendu pour prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments, fournitures scolaires et soins de sant des enfants. Madame Korotoumou C. limage des autres femmes du groupe Nytaa 1 a pour objectif dassurer lauto suffisance alimentaire dans le village et faire de llevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Nytaa 1 group are all married and living in big traditional families. Their average age is 41 and on average they have 4 children each. They live in the village of Balamissala, in the rural community of Sbougou, Sgou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and they became acquainted because they are either in-laws, neighbors, or related to each other. Wishing to expand their arable land, they came to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second agricultural (seasonal) loan. Members of the group grow rice, "fonio" (a type of millet) and okra. Mrs. Korotoumou C. wants to use her loan to buy 25 kg of rice seed, two sacks of fertilizer for grains, two tins of herbicide, and pay for labor to help her transplant the rice seedings and do the weeding in her fields. She buys her agricultural inputs at the weekly market in Sbougou and finds her laborers among the young people's association and the women of the village. With 3.1 hectares, she hopes to produce 10 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of "fonio", and about 30 sacks of okra. Part of her production will be consumed by her family, whereas the rest will be sold to have money for household needs: condiments, school supplies, and health care for her children. Mrs. Korotoumou C., like the other women of the Nytaa 1 group, aims to make the village self-sustaining in terms of food and be able to raise goats and sheep.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying fertilizer for grains, rice seeds, herbicides, and paying for labor

loan.name: Nytaa 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Nytaa 2 est compos de six femmes toutes maries dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Balamissala dans la commune rurale de Sbougou dans la rgion de Sgou (4me rgion administrative du Mali) et se sont connues travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parent. Dans le but daugmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours Soro Yiriwaso et sont leur 2me cycle de prt de campagne. Le riz, larachide, le mil et le gombo seront cultivs par les membres du groupe Nytaa 2 du village de Balamissala. Madame Maritou D. veut utiliser son prt pour acheter 30kg de semences de riz, deux sacs de complexe crale, 2 bidons dherbicide et recruter la main duvre pour les activits de labour, de repiquage et de sarclage dans ses champs. Le labour est rserv aux hommes alors que le sarclage et le repiquage sont luvre des femmes dans le village. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles la foire de Sgou (au grand march). Avec une superficie de 3 hectares, elle espre produire 8 sacs darachide, 10 sacs de riz et une trentaine de sac de gombo. Une partie de la production est auto consomme tandis que le reste est vendu pour prendre en charge les frais scolaires des enfants, les besoins du foyer ainsi que les soins de sant. Madame Maritou D. a pour objectif de faire llevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Nytaa 2 group is composed of six women, all married and living in big traditional families. Their average age is 33 and on average they have 3 children each. They live in the village of Balamissala, in the rural community of Sbougou, Sgou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and they became acquainted because they are either in-laws, neighbors, or related to each other. Wishing to expand their arable land, they came to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second agricultural (seasonal) loan. Members of the Nytaa 2 group from the village of Balamissala grow rice, peanuts, millet, and okra. Mrs. Maritou D. wants to use her loan to buy 30 kg of rice seed, two sacks of fertilizer for grains, two tins of herbicide, and pay for labor to help her prepare the soil, transplant the rice seedings, and do the weeding in her fields. Preparing the soil is work reserved for men, whereas weeding and transplanting are work done by women from the village. She buys her agricultural inputs at the weekly market in Sgou (the big market). With 3 hectares, she hopes to produce 8 sacks of peanuts, 10 sacks of rice, and about 30 sacks of okra. Part of her production will be consumed by her family, whereas the rest will be sold to have money for the children's school fees, household necessities, and health care expenses. Mrs. Maritou D. aims to be able to raise goats and sheep.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying fertilizer (a mixture for grains), rice seeds, herbicides, and paying for labor

loan.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Madame Bintou Koussoub est ge de 44 ans, marie et mre de 6 enfants. Elle vit chez son feu mari avec sa copouse dans une grande famille traditionnelle au quartier Pelengana Sbnikoro de Sgou (quatrime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Nayant pas fait lcole pour des raisons sociales, elle commena tt le petit commerce auprs de sa mre, qui vendait des condiments alimentaires au march. Aprs plusieurs annes dactivits pass auprs de cette dernire, elle volua seule en menant le commerce darticles divers tels le vente de pte darachide, de lgumes, dhabits etc. Dans le dessein daugmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de raliser plus de bnfices, elle a fait recours Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 36 mois. Aprs 2 prts solidaires et 2 prts individuels tous correctement rembourss, elle est son 3me prt individuel quelle compte utiliser pour acheter, une balle de tissus. Elle sapprovisionne sur place la COMATEX (Compagnie Malienne des Textiles). Madame Bintou Koussoub vend au comptant et crdit une clientle compose de femmes et dhommes. Avec ce prt, elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bnfice lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de la famille surtout quelle est veuve et ses enfants sont des scolaires. Son ambition est de prenniser son commerce jusqu ce que ses enfants puissent avoir la force de prendre en charge les dpenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bintou Koussoub, 44, is married and the mother of 6 children. She lives in the home of her late husband with her co-spouse, in a big traditional family in the Pelengana Sbnikoro district of Sgou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school for socio-economic reasons, she began early on to do petty trading together with her mother, who sold condiments at the market. After several years spent working with her mother, she began to work alone, selling various items such as peanut butter, vegetables, cloth, etc. Wishing to grow her working capital so that she could make more profit, she came to Soro Yiriwaso 36 months ago. With two solidarity loans and two individual loans under her belt, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her third individual loan which she intends to use to buy a bale of cloth. She buys her supplies near where she sells, at COMATEX, Compagnie Malienne des Textiles (Mali Textile Company). Mrs. Bintou Koussoub sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of women and men. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA, which will permit her to support her family, given that she is a widow and her children are still school-aged. Her ambition is to be able to continue working in this business until her children are able to take over supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying cloth for resale

loan.name: Chaka

texts.fr: Monsieur Chaka Dembl est ge de 26 ans, mari et pre de 3 enfants. il vit dans une famille nuclaire au quartier Pelengana Nord de la ville de Sgou (quatrime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Nayant pas frquent lcole pour des raisons sociales, il commena trs tt faire le commerce ct de son grand frre qui tenait une boutique de ventes darticles divers. Ayant pass plusieurs annes auprs de ce dernier, il commence voluer seul en menant plusieurs activits telles la vente de crales, de ciments, mais finit par se reconvertir dans le mtier de meunier. Il mne cette activit depuis 7 ans et jouit dune grande renomme dans son lieu de travail Bagadadji. Sa clientle est due la qualit du service fourni. Dans le dessein de faire face la demande clientle, il a fait recours Soro Yiriwaso afin acheter un nouveau moulin (dcortiqueur). Il est son 1er prt et sapprovisionnera sur place Sgou. Monsieur Chaka Dembl fait toujours ses prestations au comptant une clientle compose majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prt, il envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bnfice lui permettra de payer sa facture dlectricit, son loyer et son personnel. Son ambition est de diversifier son activit en menant le commerce de crales, sinon ouvrir un grand magasin de stockage.
texts.en:
Mr. Chaka Dembl is 26 years old, married, and the father of three children. He lives with his immediate family in the Pelengana Nord neighborhood in the city of Sgou (in the fourth administrative region of Mali). Not having been able to attend school, he went into business at a very young age with his older brother, who had a store where he sold various products. After spending several years in business with his brother, he began to develop several business activities himself, such as the sale of grain and the sale of cement; he then changed his occupation to grain milling. He has been in business as a miller for 7 years and has a very good reputation in Bagadadji, his place of work. His clientele is due to the quality of service he provides. In order to meet customer demand, he has requested help from Soro Yiriwaso to buy a new mill (huller). This is his first loan, and he will purchase the mill in Sgou. Mr. Chaka Dembl does all his business in cash, with a client base made up mostly of women. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to pay his electrical bill, his rent, and his employees. His ambition is to diversify his business by expanding to cereal sales, or to open a large warehouse.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a grain mill

loan.name: Fatoumata Dite Tata

texts.fr: Madame Fatoumata dite Tata Traor est ge de 34 ans, marie et mre de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Bagadadji de Sgou (quatrime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali). Elle abandonna lcole en classe de 6 me anne fondamentale (systme ducatif Malien) pour mener le commerce auprs de sa mre qui vendait des habits et chaussures au march de Kati. Aprs plusieurs annes dapprentissage ses cts, Fatoumata a pu matriser les rouages du petit commerce. Par la suite, elle a volu de ses propres ailes pour mener la mme activit que sa mre. Elle vend des habits, des couvertures, des draps de lit, des chaussures depuis 15 ans et jouit dune grande rputation dans le quartier. Dans le dessein daugmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de raliser plus de bnfice, elle a fait recours Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est 1er prt individuel quelle compte utiliser pour acheter, 5 couvertures et 5 pices de pagnes brods. Elle sapprovisionne Bamako auprs des grossistes. Madame Fatoumata dite Tata Traor vend au comptant et crdit une clientle compose majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prt, elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bnfice lui permettra daider son mari et de participer aux vnements sociaux (baptme, mariage etc.). Son ambition est de faire le commerce entre le Mali et lArabie Saoudite.
texts.en:
Mrs.Fatoumata (nicknamed Tata) Traor is 34 years old, married and the mother of five children.She lives with her husband and children in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Sgou (fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali). She left school in the sixth year of elementary school (under the school system of Mali) in order to work beside her mother who sold clothes and shoes in the market at Kati. After several years of apprenticeship along side her mother, Fatoumata was able to master trading on a small scale. Later, she developed her own wings and was able to carry out the same activity as her mother. She has been selling clothes, blankets, sheets and shoes for fifteen years and has a strong reputation in the neighborhood. With the goal of increasing her working capital, in order to make more profit, Fatoumata has turned to Soro Yiriwaso. This is her first individual loan, and she plans to use it to buy 5 blankets and 5 pieces of embroidered "pagne" (printed cotton fabric). Fatoumata obtains her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, then she sells for cash and on credit to customers who are, for the most part, women. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 60,000 CFA. This will enable her to help her husband and to participate in social events (baptisms, weddings, etc.). Her ambition is to trade between Mali and Saudi Arabia.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy printed fabric ("pagnes") and blankets

loan.name: Peter Gikonyo

texts.en:
Peter has been in farming in Naivasha town since 2008. He is 27 years old, married to Dorcas Nyambura and they have one child.
He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of Kshs 22,000 well and on time. He plans to use the cash from this loan to buy pesticides to spray the crops.
Peter plans to buy his own lorry, which he will be using to transport his harvest to the market place.

loan.use: To buy pesticides to spray the crops.

loan.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon A. is 45 years old and a husband and father of two children. His wife Linet is also a business person. They have a son who is in secondary school and they live in the Shinyalu area of Kakamega town.
Simon runs a carpentry business in an open-air market within the Shinyalu area. His clientele are mostly house and business owners from the neighboring estates who mostly come for household items. He was introduced to Kadet Limited by an existing client, whereby he took a first loan and paid successfully without default. He is now taking his second loan, which he plans to use to buy timber and carpentry tools.
He intends to use his profits to boost the business and his dream is to open a hardware store within Kakamega town.

loan.use: To buy timber and carpentry tools

loan.name: Ainea

texts.en:
Ainea M. is a 38-year-old carpenter in Shinyalu town. He was married but later separated from his wife and 10-year-old son.
Ainea operates his business in Shinyalu market centre where he designs any kind of furniture his clientele requests, like beds, cabinets, tables etc. He has been in the carpentry business for the last six years and has been able to meet his expenses out of the profits he makes.
He is taking his first loan from KADET Ltd and he intends to pay it well without default. He hopes to get a lender through KADET Ltd to enable him to expand the business by buying more timber, timber glue and nails.
His dream is to expand his business and diversify to poultry farming because there is demand for poultry products in his area.

loan.use: To buy more timber for carpentry work.

loan.name: Luis Narciso

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man has two little children and lives in his own house in the city of Pilar, in a place called Barrio General Diaz. The house has the basics for carrying out the family's inside activities. He also has his own motorcycle and truck.
He is in the construction business. He started this activity three years ago. It possesses all the necessary comforts for the development. He performs civil and industrial construction work of all types throughout Neembucu (a department in Eastern Paraguay).
He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of new tools to carry out a bigger amount of work. He is thankful to the Fundacion Paraguaya for the support it provided by means of granting him credit.

loan.use: To purchase tools

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is a 39-year-old modest lady from Bungoma town, Western Kenya. She is married to Thomas Kennedy and they have three children, ages 15, 10 and 8. They reside in Bungoma town.
Rose has a cereal shop in Bungoma town center and she has been operating this business for the last six years. She sells mainly maize and beans to meet the market demand in the area. She knew of Kadet through a friend who is a client, and she joined to access micro-credit. She is taking out her first loan and plans to use it to buy four sacks of cereals to sell.
From the profits she hopes to make, Rose plans to open another shop in the nearby town. Cereals are in high demand in the area and she wants to capitalize on that to generate income and also bring her business closer to the customers.

loan.use: To buy four sacks of cereals to sell.

loan.name: Deolinda Facunda

texts.en:
Ms. Deolinda is a widow. She has older children but now lives alone in a house located in the Barrio Bernardino Caballero in the city of Asuncion.
All her life, Ms. Deolinda has taught in different schools and private colleges. She did very well, according to her comments; she earned a lot of money with which she could support, raise and educate her children.
After teaching a long time in colleges and schools with numerous groups, Ms. Deolinda decided to stop this activity because she felt tired with the rhythm of life and teaching requires a lot of dedication. Nowadays, she is dedicated to teaching private students personally at home. Now, she says, managing smaller groups of students represents a bigger part of teaching on her siD. and better learning by the students.
This loan will be used to purchase a computer which is desperately needed for managing and controlling her work activities, as mentioned.

loan.use: To buy a computer

loan.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina A. is a 38-year-old enterprising mother of one 19 year old. She is married to Joseph and they stay in Bungoma town.
Penina has been operating a poultry business for the last seven years in Bungoma, a town located in the western part of Kenya. She operates her business from her homestead where clients come and select poultry to purchase at wholesale or retail prices. Good customer relations keep her going in this business because customers come from far away to buy her poultry.
She learned about Kadet Limited through a friend who introduced her to a group. She joined and took out her first loan which she paid without default. She is now taking out her second loan and plans to use it to buy more poultry for raising which she will later sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.
Her desire is that one day she will become a leading supplier of poultry to five star hotels in Western Kenya.

loan.use: To buy poultry to raise and sell.

loan.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam Harutunyan is married and has three children. The family lives in a private house on the outskirts of Yerevan city. The front part of the house is remodeled into a modest tavern, where Mariam prepares delicious barbecue. Her tavern is on a road that leads to a site in the country with picnic areas. so most of Mariam's customers visit the tavern to buy barbecue for a picnic. To meet the clients' demands and to expand her business Mariam is planning to open a small grocery shop.

loan.use: to open a small grocery shop

loan.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and has three children. She lives in Novyi Rozdil where she sells sheets, blankets and bed linens in the local marketplace. She started her business fifteen years ago. Presently, she has 10,000 UAH in inventory and her income is over $1,100.
Galina is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase her working capital and her sales as a result. She is a good planner which has always helped her approach all her liabilities with wisdom and responsibility. She admits it was risky to launch her enterprise fifteen years ago when there was so much instability in the country. However, she is happy she ventured and succeeded.
Galina is hoping to keep her business running smoothly which would help her provide for her family needs and pay all the bills.

loan.use: to increase her working capital

loan.name: Peter Juma

texts.en:
Peter has been in the quarrying business in Naivasha town for the last twenty-one years. He is 40 years old, married to Rosemary Achieng, and they have four children.
He was introduced to KADET by his friend and has no history with any other micro-finance institution. This will be his first loan with KADET micro-finance. He will use it to pay his workers and add more workers to help in extraction.
In the future, Peter plans to buy his own lorry which he will use to transport the extracted stones to his clients.

loan.use: To pay his workers and add more workers to help in extraction.

loan.name: Way Forward Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Way Forward group. They are people with small-scale businesses in the small town of Waterloo where Shine on Sierra Leone partnered with SMT to start a branch.
These people have come to SMT, also a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,600,000 in order to further boost their businesses. Consequently, their living standards will improve and they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick.
Haja Aminata S. (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Kambia, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-two years of age, is married to a businessman, and they have one child who is in college.
Haja sells used-clothes and has been running this business for many years now. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy at least a bale of used clothes to add to her stock.

loan.use: To buy at least a bale of used clothes to add to her stock

loan.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married and has a 4-year-old child. He is a businessman from Kamenka and owns a store selling spare vehicle parts and accessories. His store is located right in downtown Kamenka which makes it a popular stop for car owners. Ruslan finds an individual approach to each customer. He has much experience, having worked in this sphere of trade for eleven years. Currently, he has 50,000 - 60,000 UAH in turnover capital.
Ruslan is requesting a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase additional merchandise such as tires, acoustic engineering systems and spares. His business is very popular in Ukraine where more and more people can afford to buy a car or get a car loan. One of Ruslan's long-term plans is to start a second store and open a grocery store in the future.

loan.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell

loan.name: David Ochieng

texts.en:
David has been in the quarry business in Naivasha town for the last six years. Quarrying is a very common activity in the Naivasha region. He is 35 years old, married to Caroline Achieng, and they have three children.
He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 1st loan. He plans to buy another piece of land for stone extraction.
David hopes to own many extraction sites which will increase his output so that he can meet the demands of his clients.

loan.use: To buy another piece of land.

loan.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena B. lives with her her family in Akhlatyan village in the Syunik region of Armenia. Elena is a pensioner and the main income for her family comes from the family's farming business. They keep cattle and cultivate the land. Their machinery is very old and often breaks down. With the help of this loan Elena and her husband will be able to fix the machinery and buy diesel fuel and seeds.

loan.use: fix the machinery and buy diesel fuel and seeds

loan.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with an 11-year-old daughter, Alina. Larisa is a clothing sales entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk in the Dnepropetrovsk region. She sells men's outerwear, such as jeans, shirts and t-shirts in the central market of her home town. Her hard work and natural openness have been instrumental in her business expansion. Larisa has been in the market for six years. Currently, she has 30,000 UAH in inventory.
Larisa is hoping to use the loan of 16,400 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and diversify the assortment of inventory she offers for sale. Larisa's business is a considerable contribution to the family's budget. She and her husband work hard to make some savings to pay for their daughter's studies in college.

loan.use: to buy more merchandise and expand her assortment

loan.name: Bernard Mwai

texts.en:
Bernard is a farmer and has been farming in Naivasha town since 2008. He is 38 years old, married to Jane Njeri, and they have two children.
He was introduced to KADET by his friend and he has no history with any other micro-finance institutions. This will be his 2nd loan with KADET. He paid his first loan of 15,000 KES well and on time. He plans to use the cash to buy and plant potato seedlings.This region is well known for producing a good harvest of potatoes.
Bernard hopes to buy a pick-up van in the future which he will use to transport his harvest from the farm to the market.

loan.use: To buy and plant potato seedlings

loan.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two grown children. She is a clothing merchandise vendor in the central marketplace of her home town of Novomoskovsk. Nataliya sells men's clothing items. Her kiosk is located in a busy place at the market. This is an important factor impacting the growth of Nataliya's venture. Her professional marketing skills only add to its success.
Nataliya has been in business for seven years. Presently, she has 40,000 UAH in inventory. Her profit amounts to approximately $900 a month. Nataliya is seeking a loan of 16,400 UAH to purchase seasonal merchandise for the upcoming fall season. She is planning to open one more vending location in the near future. One of her long term plans is to help her children start their own businesses.

loan.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise to sell

loan.name: David Kinuthia

texts.en:
David has been a farmer since 2009. He is 38 years old, married to Loise Wanjiku, and they have three school-going children.
He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his 2nd loan. He paid his previous loan of 25,000 KES well and on time. He plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy fertilizer and pay his casual workers.
David's future plan is to buy his own farming and harvesting machinery which will facilitate faster work. At the moment he has to hire out which is expensive. Through hard work he plans to buy his own harvesting machine.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and pay his casual workers.

loan.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 28 years old and married with two children: Belinda 8 and Shifa 3. She has been selling clothes for two years. She learned the skills for running her own business when she was previously employed in a boutique.
She appreciates Faulu Kenya for training her in business management skills. She has also benefited from Faulu Kenya through the Pambazuko group because she can save her money with them. Besides, she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.
She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock. She hopes to expand her business and invest in a plot of land in the future.

loan.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loan.name: Dancun Wanyoike

texts.en:
Dancun has been making bricks in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 30 years old, married to Peninah Mugure, and they have two children.
He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 1st loan. He plans to use the cash to buy four sacks of cement and sand which he will use to make more blocks of bricks.
Dancun hopes to have a construction company in the future where he will be making bricks for selling in large quantities.

loan.use: To buy cement and sand for making bricks.

loan.name: Agnetta Achieng

texts.en:
Agnetta has been selling fish in Naivasha town for the last twenty-one years. She is 53 years old, married to Joseph O., and they have four children.
She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan. She plans to use the cash as working capital, which she will use to pay for transporting her fish from the lake to the main market.
In the future, she hopes to venture into other markets and towns to sell her fish.

loan.use: To transport fish from the lake to the market.

loan.name: Joyce Wangari

texts.en:
Joyce has operated her cafe in Naivasha town since the year 2002. She is 23 years old, married to Samuel M., and they have four school-going children.
She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan. She plans to use the cash to expand her cafe and add more seating space to cater to her ever-growing clientele.
In the future Joyce hopes to expand and have her own mid-size hotel.

loan.use: To expand her cafe.

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a single man who sells charcoal to earn a living. He is a member of the Neema group in Faulu Kenya. He is an active member of the group because he attends their weekly meetings regularly and pays his dues well.
He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES through the group. With the loan, he will add to his stock of charcoal. He hopes to invest in another business in the future, which will be selling gas cylinders.

loan.use: To add to his stock of charcoal

loan.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married lady with two children: Pauline, 6, and Samson, 8. She owns and operates Judy grocery shop with two employees. She has engaged in the business for three years.
She is a member of Granary group in Faulu Kenya. Since she joined the group, she has learned how to keep business records. The group has guaranteed her loan of 50,000 KES.
She will use the money to buy bags for packing coconuts and add to her stock of coconuts. She hopes to expand her business and employ more people.

loan.use: To add stock of coconuts and bags for packing coconuts

loan.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 31-year-old married man. He has a one-year-old child. He has been operating a butcher shop for four years and has three employees.
Paul is an active member of a group in Faulu Kenya where he saves his money on a weekly basis. So far, he has managed to finance his business through the group. This is because the members of the group guarantee each others' loans.
He wants to take out his second loan of 80,000 KES which he will use to buy bulls for slaughter. Paul is a hardworking man who hopes to buy a lorry for transporting bulls for slaughter in the future.

loan.use: To buy bulls for slaughter

loan.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 37 years old and widowed with three school-aged children. She sells secondhand books. She has been in the business for five years. Her business is situated in an open air market. She says that she gets many customers when students start school after their holiday.
She joined Umoja B group in Faulu Kenya two years ago. She has previously been guaranteed loans twice by the group. Because she has a good reputation in repaying her loans, she has been allowed to take out another loan of 40,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy another table for displaying her books and for adding to her stock.
She hopes to open a bookshop in the future.

loan.use: To buy another table for displaying her books and add stock

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy scrap metals for making his products and materials for making a cowshed

loan.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 32-year-old married lady who is blessed with an 8-year-old son who goes to school.
Jackline joined the Umoja B Group in 2008 so as to easily access loans. She was previously operating a cafeteria where she was mainly selling chips. Later, she took out a loan of 20, 000 KES which she used as capital to start her current business which is selling clothes.
This is Jacklines sixth year operating the business and she now earns a better income and is able to educate her son. She has requested 40,000 KES to buy premises where she can store her business stock. With the money, she also wants to add stock.
Jackline hopes to expand her business into a wholesale operation in the future.

loan.use: To purchase a business premises and to add stock

loan.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 39-year-old married lady with two children who go to school. She has been operating a cafeteria for six years and also does farming for extra income.
Teresia joined Nuru Investment Group in Faulu Kenya and has learnt how to save her money through the group. She was previously guaranteed a loan of 10,000 KES by the group and used the loan to boost her business. She successfully repaid the loan.
Teresia has requested another loan of 50,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, rice and a refrigerator. She hopes to improve her business so as to raise her standard of living. She hopes to own a hotel (a larger restaurant) in ten years time.

loan.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, rice and a refrigerator

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and is married. She is blessed with two children who go to school (they are shown in the photo wearing their school uniforms).
Elizabeth is a hardworking business lady who has been engaged in different businesses. She currently operates a greengrocers and a retail shop. She was previously operating a cafeteria. She also operates a transport business for extra income.
Elizabeth is a member of Faulu Kenya and she previously took out a loan of 70,000 KES and repaid it successfully. She has requested another loan of 80,000 KES to buy a cow as she wants to start rearing dairy cows for milk.
Elizabeth hopes to expand her retail shop into a wholesale operation in future.

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For home improvements: strengthen walls and replace roof.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For home improvements and some personal expenses.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more pants and quail eggs.

loan.name: Kossi

texts.fr: kossi exerce comme activit gnratrice de revenu le commerce de dtail de produits gnriques, il fait ce commerce depuis 2008, il exerce cette activit dans un petit cabine qu'il a nomm "Ets MAWULI".il est clibataire et c'est grce ce commerce qu'il subvient ses charges. il a dj obtenu de WAGES un prt qu'il a bien rembours. Il sollicite un deuxime prt pour se rapprovisionner en achetant divers produits gnriques.
texts.en:
Kossi has a revenue-generating retail business involving generic products. He has been working at it since 2008 and operates out of a small booth he has named "Ets MAWULI". He is unmarried, and thanks to this business, he supports himself. Kossi has already obtained a loan from WAGES that he has repaid. He is requesting a second loan to stock up again by buying a variety of generic products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying generic products

loan.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo Amrico y su hijo Frank. Hace varios aos atrs Beatriz se las ingenio para abrir un pequeo negocio que consistira en vender huevos de codorniz de forma ambulatoria. Actualmente ella y su esposo trabajan juntos y al principio tenan una carretilla pero ahora tienen tres. Ellos sirven a sus clientes 5 huevos de codorniz en una bolsa de plstico y el valor del producto cuesta un nuevo sol. La pueden encontrar en su carretilla, que est equipado de mercadera, los das sbados y domingos, desde las 7 de la maana hasta bastante tarde de la noche, o hasta que se agote el suministro de huevo de codorniz.
Beatriz tambin vende en el mercado de Vino Canchn de la ciudad del Cusco, de lunes a viernes, donde vende aretes. Ya son 6 a 8 aos que se dedica a la venta de aretes y le va muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.
Con su prximo prstamo, Beatriz espera recibir $200 USD. Por el momento, su negocio de venta de aretes esta modestamente equipado con la mercadera necesaria pero quiere aumentar el capital del negocio. Le gustara emplear el dinero del prstamo para comprar ms aretes.
Beatriz pertenece al banco comunal El Amanecer. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y los socios le han reafirmado la confianza para los prstamos.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in the city of Cusco with her husband, Amrico, and her son, Frank. Several years ago Beatriz figured out a way to open a small business selling quail eggs door to door. Currently she and her husband work together. At the beginning they had just one cart but now they own three. They sell a plastic bag with five quail eggs for the price of one new sol. She can be found working with her cart stocked with her merchandise on Saturdays and Sundays from 7am until late at night or until she sells out her supply of quail eggs. Beatriz also sells earrings in Cuscos Vino Canchn market from Monday through Friday. She has been selling earrings for about 6 or 8 years. She does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Beatriz expects to get $200 USD in her next loan. Her earring sales business is currently modestly stocked. Shed like to enlarge her inventory so will use the loan to buy more earrings. Beatriz is a member of the El Amanecer (Dawn) communal bank. She has participated in several cycles to date and her fellow members have reconfirmed the trust they have in her for loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy more earrings.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To improve his house he will change the gate to his house

loan.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, de 22 aos, es una buena madre de familia, convive con Percy de 26 aos y sus tres hermosas hijas, que son su razn de vivir, juntos viven en casa de su suegra. Papa, arveja, maz y gladiolos, es lo que siembra desde hace 3 aos, junto a su esposo, en los terrenos que le cedi su suegra. Ahora que naci la ltima de sus hijas, no puede realizar mucho esfuerzo fsico, por lo que se limita a cuidar a los animales que cra, como: toros, carneros, caballos y asnos, que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos y herramientas agrcolas hacia los terrenos que trabajar. Lo que ms le gusta, es secar el maz que cosech y vender las flores de gladiolos por paquetes en el mercado de su ciudad. Su esposo le gusta criar ganado vacuno, es por ello que desea comprar toros, asimismo desea continuar con la siembra. Recientemente planea con su esposo conseguir un capital de trabajo y viajar a una localidad llamada Cerro de Pasco, donde tendra la posibilidad de instalar un restaurante, aprovechando que hay asentamientos mineros, en donde son muchas las personas que trabajaran en ese lugar. Este es el tercer crdito con MFP, y asegura que le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque est integrada por personal unidas. Con el crdito que solicita, comprar semillas de arveja y varios sacos de guano de corral para sembrarlos.
texts.en:
Alidia, 22, lives with her husband, Percy, 26, and their three beautiful daughters. She is an attentive mother and her children are her reason for living. The family lives with Alidia's mother-in-law. For the past 3 years, she and her husband have grown potatoes, peas, maize and gladiolus on land given to them by the mother-in-law. Since the birth of her youngest child, Alidia hasn't been able to work as hard as before and, consequently, she limits herself to taking care of the animals--bulls, rams, horses and donkeys--that help them to move agricultural tools and supplies to the fields where they work. The parts of the business that Alidia likes best is drying the maize after a harvest and selling gladiolus in the city's flower market. Her husband wants to raise cattle so she wants to buy bulls. She also wants to continue with the farming business. Recently, she and her husband have talked about pulling together enough working capital to set up a restaurant at a mining settlement called Cerro de Pasco where they could make the most of the demand among the miners there. This is Alidia's third MFP loan. She says that she likes working with her community bank because the members of the group support one another. With this loan, Alidia will buy seeds and bags of manure for sowing a new crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Seeds and manure for farming business.

loan.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: afiwa est une jeune femme clibataire qui s'est lanc depuis plus de 5 ans dj dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation gnrale; elle s'approvisionne au grand march de Lom sa clientle se compose de toutes personnes.elle veut gonfler son stock pour mieux vendre et accrotre ses recettes. raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crdit pour l'achat de 4 cartons de dtergents, 3 sac de riz, 2 cartons de ptes alimentaires et divers produits d'alimentation gnrale
texts.en:
Afiwa A. is a young unmarried woman who went into the business selling general food products five years ago. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lom. She would like to increase her stock so as to sell more and increase her earnings. This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 4 cartons of detergent, 3 sacks of rice, 2 cartons of pasta and various general food products.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy general food products

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: K. est une femme marie, elle vit avec son poux dans le quartier de gbenyedzi qui est un quartier priphrique de la ville de Lom. Elle exerce comme activit gnratrice de revenu le commerce de jus de fruist qu'elle achte au grand march de Lom. elle a commenc ce commerce il y a un an. son dsir est d'agrandir ce commerce et pour ce faire elle demande un prt WAGES pour acheter une vingtaine de cartons de jus de fruits.
texts.en:
Ablavi K. is a married woman. She lives with her husband in the Gbenyedzi district on the periphery of the city of Lom. Her line of business is selling fruit juice which she buys at the large market in Lom. She started this business a year ago. She wants to expand her business and to do that, she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy around twenty cartons of fruit juice.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cartons of fruit juice

loan.name: Mohamed S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Kulafai Rashideen Primary School in Waterloo small town, where Shine on Sierra Leone partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded in September 1996. It is staffed with thirteen teachers and 363 pupils.
These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to seek an SLL 15,100,000 loan. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to embark on some meaningful projects that their mere salaries alone cant support. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials or a piece of land, pay school fees for their children, or invest the loan in their business.
Mohamed S. B. is the leader of this group of teachers. He is age forty-nine, is married to a businesswoman, and they have six children. Mr. B. will use his share of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loan.use: To pay school fees for his children

loan.name: Honest Labour Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the Honest Labour group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leones capital city, and the town where Shine on Sierra Leone partnered with SMT to start a branch.
This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Nannah K. who is age thirty-seven and was born in Waterloo. Nannah is married and has four children two are in secondary school and two are in primary school.
For eight years now, Nannah has sold sugar, oil, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), rice, gari (a fast-food made from cassava), etc. With her share of this loan, Nannah will buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her stock.

loan.use: To buy more palm-oil, vegetable oil, Margi, rice, gari, sugar, etc.

loan.name: Na God Da Gee Group

texts.en:
Aminata C. is the leader of this group of five entrepreneurs. She was born about forty-seven years ago in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with three children who are all grown-ups now. For eight years now, Aminata has been selling cassava roots, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots), etc.
This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions.
Aminata will use her SLL 500,000 share of the loan to expand her business; she will buy cassava roots, gallons of palm-oil, gari, foo-foo, etc., to add to her current stock.

loan.use: To buy more cassava roots, gallons of palm-oil, gari, foo-foo, etc., to add to her current stock

loan.name: Emergildo

texts.es: Emergildo, tiene 40 aos y est casado con Deysi de 28 aos, ambos tienen un hijo Nelvis, de 4 aos, ellos viven en su casa propia. Siembra papa, arveja, avena, maz y gladiolo, en sus terrenos propios, lleva 15 aos, en la agricultura y en poca de cosecha, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, quien es comerciante y posee una tienda, trabajando todos los das desde tempranas horas de la maana. Por otro lado cra animal ovino, en el que luego son vendidos, y cuya ganancia le ayuda en el sustento de la familia, otro de los animales que tiene son los asnos, que le ayudan a trasladar sus insumos y herramientas agrcolas a las chacras donde trabajar. Lo que ms le gusta de su labor, es surcar la tierra para sembrar, porque siempre consider que su actividad agrcola es bastante rentable porque le permite cubrir sus gastos domsticos y que su familia tenga una adecuada calidad de vida, por ello, para el futuro, quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad sobre todo arveja y gladiolo, tambin anhela incrementar la mercadera de su bodega. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crdito con MFP, y est contento de trabajar en su grupo comunal, donde integra la junta directiva, con el cargo de fiscal. Con el crdito que solicita, comprar dos bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgnico.
texts.en:
Emergildo, 40, is married to Deysi, 28. They have a 4-year old son, Nelvis, and live in a house that they own. They grow potatoes, peas, oats, maize and gladiolus. Emergildo has farmed for 15 years. At harvest time, he counts on support from his wife. He also operates a store. Emergildo works every day from early in the morning. In addition to the farm, he raises sheep which he then sells. The earnings go to supporting his family. He also has donkeys that help him move agricultural tools and supplies to the fields where he works. What he most likes about his work is plowing his fields before planting. The farm is fairly profitable and he is able to cover the family's expenses and provide them with a decent quality of life. In the future, he wants to plant larger crops of peas and gladiolus. He would also like to increase the merchandise in his store. This is Emergildo's fourth MFP loan. He likes his community bank where is among the directors. He will use this loan to buy two bags of seed and several sacks of organic manure.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy seed and manure for farming business.

loan.name: Better Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Better group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where Shine on Sierra Leone partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.
Abibatu S. is the leader of this group. The 34-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children three in primary school and two in secondary school.
Abibatu has been a businesswoman for five years now; she sells palm-oil (the countrys most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loan.use: To buy more palm-oil, rice, beans, groundnuts, etc.

loan.name: Hold Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the Hold Sorbeh group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where Shine on Sierra Leone partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are women with small businesses who have come to SMT in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.
The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Zainab K. who was born in Moyamba, in southern Sierra Leone, forty-two years ago. She is married to a businessman and has six children. Two of her children are attending primary school and four are in secondary school.
Zainab has been selling cooked rice, firewood and charcoal for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy more rice, firewood, and charcoal in large quantities to add to her stock.

loan.use: To buy rice, firewood, and charcoal in large quantities to add to her stock

loan.name: Dim Din I Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the Dim Din I group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Isatu J. who is age thirty-two and was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and has one child. Her child is attending primary school.
For five years now, Isatu has sold slippers/flip-flops, underwear, and cosmetics. With her share of this loan, she will improve on the size and quality of her business by buying more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loan.use: To buy more slippers/flip-flops, underwear and cosmetics to add to her stock

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 27 aos, es una mujer ejemplar y luchadora que vive con su pareja Marcelino, de 29 aos y sus dos pequeos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 aos se dedica a sembrar habas, papa, arveja maz gladiolo, para venderlos en los das festivos, su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa elctrica colocando postes de luz, la ayuda en la comercializacin. En tanto cuando es temporada de siembra y cosecha, Carmen contrata operarios para que pueda agilizar su labor. Lo que ms le gusta es sembrar y cosechar la arveja porque le resulta rentable por la demanda que tiene en los mercados de su ciudad, donde el saco lo vende a S/. 50.00 soles al por mayor. Para Carmen, la agricultura es rentable porque le permite cubrir los gastos de su familia y las primeras necesidades de toda su familia, por eso en el futuro, desea continuar en la agricultura pero sembrando en mayor cantidad, adems piensa arreglar su vivienda para instalar una tienda de comestibles. Este es su cuarto crdito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal porque se siente en familia, ya que as aprende a ser ms responsable. Con el crdito que recibir, pretende comprar semilla de arveja y varios pies tablares de madera para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen, 27, an exemplary, hard-working woman, lives with her husband, Marcelo, 29, and their two young children in a house that they own. She has operated a farming business for 10 years, growing broad beans, potatoes, peas, maize and gladiolus, that she then sells on market days. Her husband, who works erecting power lines for an electric utility, helps her on the farm. Carmen also hires laborers during the planting and harvesting season to speed up the work. What she most likes about the business is planting and harvesting peas because the return on the crop in the city's wholesale market comes to S/.50 (50 new soles) a bag. Farming is a good business for Carmen because the profits from the business cover the family's expenses. She wants to continue farming and plant bigger crops. She would also like to set up a shop to sell basic food items. This is Carmen's fourth MFP loan. She likes working with her community bank because she considers them family and because they have taught her how to be more responsible. She will use this loan to buy seed for the farm and supplies to set up a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Seed for farming business. Materials for setting up a corner shop.

loan.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL EL PROGRESO
La alcanca comunal EL PROGRESO es un grupo formado por 9 socias y 1 socio que viven en una misma urbanizacin, con el tiempo D. casi 4 aos trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PORSPERIDAD han formado una buena amistad porque han mostrado ayuda a sus compaeras y ser mas activas en el grupo.
Tina tiene 38 aos D. edad, tiene 2 hijos que aun depenD. D. ella y vive con su esposo en su casa propia, ella se dedica a vender fruta en el mercado que esta cerca a su casa, es un puesto que lo alquila a mercado, y por lo que es un negocio propio le da la libertad D. ser la tesorera D. la alcanca comunal
Ella tiene mucho empeo y entusiasmo junto con su compaeras D. alcanca comunal, Tina sale muy temprano a un terminal que esta muy lejos D. su casa para conseguir la fruta en gran cantidad a un menor precio para ofrecerla en el mercado donD. ella venD., y as ganar el dinero para el sustento D. su familia.
Tina suea con ver a sus hijos profesionales y dar refaccin a su casa.
texts.en:
El Progreso Communal Bank The El Progreso Communal Bank is a group maD. up of 9 female members and one male member who all live in the same neighborhood. Having worked for almost 4 years with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, they have formed a close friendship because they have helped each other out and become more active in the group. Tina is 38 years old. She has 2 children that still depend on her and she lives with her husband in their own house. She sells fruit in the market that is close to her house. She rents a place in the market and since it is her own business she is able to act as the treasurer of the communal bank. She is very hardworking and enthusiastic, as are her fellow members of the communal bank. Tina leaves very early in the morning to go to a bus terminal that is far from her house to get the fruit in large quantities at a lower price so she can sell it in the market she works from. This is how she earns the money to proviD. for her family. Tina dreams of seeing her children become professionals and of refurbishing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She will buy fruits such as papaya, oranges, pinapples, apples, pears, plantains, etc. and the transportation for them.

loan.name: Delbor

texts.es: Delbor, de 33 aos, es un hombre laborioso, que vive con su esposa Cledina de 33 aos con quien tiene 2 hijos, todos ellos viven en su domicilio propio, en la localidad de Patay. Son ms de 13 aos que se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa y arveja en terrenos que posee, y con la ayuda su esposa, lo gran producir una buena calidad de estos productos. Generalmente su esposa es la encargada de las labores domsticas, dando adems los cuidados adecuados a sus hijos. Lo que ms le gusta a Delbor es cultivar papa y ver como florecen, porque es bastante cuidadoso con sus cultivos, pues est seguro que el buen mantenimiento de las tierras es pieza clave para obtener una cosecha exitosa. Por otro lado le incomoda luchar contra las variaciones climticas, pues el viento y las lluvias son muy fuertes y no dejan que se desarrollo con normalidad. l, firme continua, pues considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable porque le permite cubrir la educacin de sus hijos, cubrir los gastos domiciliarios y ahorrar para comprar ms bienes, para que pueda sembrar en mayor cantidad, adems de instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en un espacio de su casa. Es el cuarto crdito con MFP, y est feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes trabajan de manera activa. Con el crdito, piensa comprar varios sacos de abono orgnico para su prxima siembra.
texts.en:
Delbor is 33 years old. He is a hardworking man who lives with his wife, Cledina, who is 33 years old and with whom he has 2 children. They all live together in their own house, in the town of Patay. He has been working in agriculture for more than 13 years, planting potatoes and peas on some pieces of land he owns. Generally his wife is in charge of the domestic work and caring for their children. What Delbor likes most is cultivating potatoes and watching them as they grow because he is very careful with his crops; he is certain that taking good care of the land is the key to having successful harvests. On the other hand, he dislikes fighting against the climatic variations. The wind and the rain are very strong and they dont let the plants develop normally. He is steadfast and continues in his work because he finds his work profitable since it allows him to cover educating his children, the costs of his household, and to save to buy more land so he can plant more. He has also been able to open a small grocery store in his house. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is happy to continue working with the members of his communal bank, who all work actively. With his loan he plans to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer for his next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loan.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris vive en la ciudad del Cusco y est casada con Donato. Fruto de esta unin tienen dos hijos hermosos. Hace dos aos atrs Beatriz se las ingenio para abrir un pequeo negocio de venta de ropa y venta de herramientas. El negocio consiste en comprar mercadera de diferentes ciudades como de Lima, Tacna y Desaguadero. Una vez comprado la mercadera, Doris lleva a vender a las ciudades de Quillabamba y Puerto Maldonado. Doris vende a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y a bajos costos y por ese motivo sus clientes se van contentos y despus vuelen. Los clientes de Doris le dicen de cario CASERA.
Actualmente, ella y su esposo trabajan en diferentes negocios. Al principio tenan poco capital pero necesitaban ms dinero, entonces se les presento la oportunidad de pertenecer a la Asociacin Arariwa quien les presta dinero.
Con su prximo prstamo, Doris espera recibir $600 USD. Por el momento, su negocio de venta de ropa y herramientas esta modestamente equipado con mercadera surtida, pero quiere aumentar el capital del negocio. Le gustara emplear el dinero del prstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo pantalones y polos.
Doris participa en el banco comunal El Amanecer, y sus compaeras le han reafirmado la confianza para los prstamos
texts.en:
Doris lives in the city of Cusco and is married to Donato. They have two beautiful children. Two years ago, Doris figured a way to open a small business selling clothing and tools. She buys merchandise from different cities, such as Lima, Tacna, and Desaguadero. Once the merchandise is purchased, Doris takes it to sell in the cities of Quillabamba and Puerto Maldonado. Doris sells her customers good-quality products at low prices; they leave happy and then return again. Doris customers affectionately call her Casera ["Homebody"]. Currently she and her husband work in different businesses. At first they had little capital and needed more money. Then they were presented with the opportunity to belong to the Asociacin Arariwa, which lends money. With her next loan Doris expects to receive $600.00. For the moment, her business selling clothing and tools is modestly stocked with merchandise, but she wants to increase capital for the business. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy clothing such as pants and polo shirts. Doris participates in the El Amanecer [The Dawn] communal bank and her fellow members have reaffirmed their trust in her for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy clothing such as pants and polo shirts

loan.name: Norma Agustina

texts.es:
Norma Agustina R. C. tiene 38 aos de edad, reside en el Barrio La Hoya de Juticalpa, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 11 aos. Ella comenzo vendiendo cosmeticos de forma ambulante pero no le quedaba suficiente dinero ni tiempo para atender a su familia, entonces cambio de negocio y establecio una chiclera al frente de su casa de habitacion y vendia todo tipo de galletas y gran variedad de dulces. Hace trece aos decidio establecer en una parte de su casa una pequea pulperia y ahora ella se dedica a vender todo tipo de abarroteria, su horario de atencion es de Lunes a Domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm y sus hijos le ayudan a atenderla, y tiene mas tiempo para su familia.
Necesita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia con productos de la canasta basica, como arroz, azucar, jabon, manteca, aceite, leche, pollo, harina, aceite, condimentos, salsas, pastas, churros, galletas, dulces, refrescos, etc. Asi ella podra ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos.
Su sueo es que su negocio sea mas grande y que produzca las suficientes ganancias para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y escolares, ya que ella desea que sus hijos sean profesionales para que tengan una mejor vida.
Ha sido clienta de FAMA por 4 ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma muy puntual, y gracias a los prestamos que ha obtenido cuenta con su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma Agustina R. C. is 38, and lives in the La Hoya de Juticalpa neighborhood. She has 2 children, 15 and 11, and she is married. She began selling cosmetics as a street vendor but she didnt have enough money nor time left to take care of her family. Then she changed the business and set up a sweets stand in front of her house and sold all types of cookies and a big variety of candies. Three years ago she decided to open a small general store in one part of her house and now she sells all kinds of merchandise. Her hours in the store are Monday through Sunday from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm, and her children help her take care of it which gives her more time with the family. She needs a loan to stock the store with basics such as rice, sugar, soap, lard, oil, chicken, flour, oil, condiments, sauces, pasta, churros (fried crullers), cookies, candies, soft drinks, etc. This way she can offer her customers a wide variety of products. Her dream is to grow her business and that it will offer sufficient income to be able to help her husband with family and school expenses, since she wants her children to be professionals so that they can have a better life. She has been a client of FAMA for 4 cycles and has made her payments punctually, and thanks to the loans, she has been able to keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy general merchandise

loan.name: Donato

texts.es:
Donato naci en la ciudad de Abancay y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposa Doris y sus dos hijos. Al cumplir 16 aos, Donato ingreso al instituto superior SENATI (Servicio Nacional de Adiestramiento al Desarrollo en Tecnolgico Industrial) en la ciudad de Abancay y aprendi el oficio de la carpintera y ebanistera. Hace varios aos atrs, Donato ejerce su profesin en su ciudad natal, pero como existe mucha competencia decidi buscar otro lugar donde pueda trabajar.
Decidido a empezar una nueva vida, Donato se mudo a Cusco, Per, donde tena parientes lejanos. Utilizo sus ahorros para alquilar un terreno, donde ah pueda elaborar muebles de madera. Le pueden encontrar en su taller, que est equipado con pocas maquinarias, de lunes a viernes, desde las 8 de la maana hasta 11 de la noche y los das sbados y domingos en la feria de Tpac Amaru en del distrito de Wanchaq de la provincia del Cusco donde vende los muebles.
Con su prximo prstamo, Donato espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, su taller esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades bsicas. Le gustara emplear el dinero del prstamo para comprar madera y materiales.
Donato participa en el banco comunal El Amanecer y sus compaeros le han reafirmado la confianza para los prstamos.
texts.en:
Donato was born in the town of Abancay and currently lives in the city of Cusco, along with his wife, Doris, and their two children. When he turned 16, Donato began attending the institute of higher education SENATI (National Service for Training and Development in Industrial Technology) in the city of Abancay and he learned the trade of carpentry and cabinet making. Several years ago Donato worked in his trade in the city of Decidido. Starting a new life, Donato moved to Cusco, Peru, where he had distant relatives. He used his savings to rent a piece of land where he could make wood furniture. He can now be found in his workshop, which is equipped with a few machines, Monday through Friday from 8:00 in the morning to 11:00 at night. On Saturdays and Sundays he is at the Tpac Amaru market in the Wanchaq district of the province of Cusco, where he sells his furniture. With his next loan, Donato expects to receive $400.00. For the moment his workshop is modestly stocked with the basic necessities. He would like to use the money from the loan to buy wood and materials. Donato participates in the El Amanecer [The Dawn] communal bank and his fellow members have reaffirmed their trust in him for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy wood and materials

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Ms. Raquel G. is 26 years old and lives in the urban rea of the city of Encarnacion since some time. Ms. Raquel is a merchant and she ownes a local sale and sctivations of cell pones business in the rea of San Isidro on the way to Itacua. She is very dedicated to this activity for over two years and she is doing very well because it is located in an rea with a lot of work and consortiums. They perform monthly activities for the consortium and this gives a good profit margin, in addition they carry out repairments of celular phones. Trough this activity, she and her husband can maintain the home, daily expenses and cover anything unexpected that turns up.
She has requested this loan to buy more goods such as cell phones of various models, linings and spare parts in general.
texts.en:
Raquel is 26 years old and has lived in the urban area of the city of Encarnacin for some time. Raquel is a merchant and she owns a local business that sells and activates cell phones, located in the San Isidro area on the way to Itacua. She has been very involved in this activity for more than 2 years and is doing very well. The business is located in an area with a lot of work and consortia taking place. Such monthly activities provide for a good profit margin. In addition, she also offers cell phone repairs. By means of this activity, Raquel and her husband maintain their home, meet daily needs, and manage to cover any unexpected expenses. Raquel requests this loan to buy more goods, including cell phones of various models, and cases, plus spare parts in general.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: BUYING CELL PHONES OF VARIOUS MODELS PLUS CASES AND SPARE PARTS

loan.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel V. R. tiene 42 anos. Es soltero y vive con su familia en el cantn de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene un nio de 1 ano 3 meses.
Miguel Angel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.
Miguel Angel se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en el canton de Ventanas.
Solicita el prstamo para avanzar en su agricultura. Su sueno es tener un futuro mejor que antes. Le gusta practicar deportes y pasear en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel V. R. is 42 years old, single, and lives with his family in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ros. He has a son who is a year and three months old. Miguel Angel is a member of the Communal Bank Lucha Para Triunfar (Fight To Win). There are 13 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Miguel Angel is a farmer who grows primarily corn. He buys and sells in the canton of Ventanas. The loan he is requesting will be used to advance his farming activities. He dreams of having a better future than he had before.

In his free time, Miguel Angel enjoys practicing sports and going for walks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in his farming activities

loan.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, es una mujer bastante trabajadora tiene 30 aos y vive con su pareja Nilton de 30 aos con quien tiene 2 hijos que son su adoracin, todos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 aos trabaja en la agricultura, tuvo a sus padres, quienes la capacitaron en esta labor, es por ello que ahora junto a su esposo, le ensean todas las tcnicas agrcolas a sus hijos, quienes de vez en cuando le ayudan en pequeos labores en el campo, cultivando caf, pltano y palta. Disfruta mucho las diferentes labores que practica en la chacra, y cuando quiere agilizar su trabajo contrata operarios, de esa manera puede descansar tranquila y sentir seguridad de que obtendr una buena produccin. Elsa, es muy precavida, ya que est convencida de que una excelente cosecha depende de las atenciones, por eso considera que su labor en la agricultura es bastante rentable, porque le permite adquirir bienes, educar a sus hijos y puede cubrir diferentes gastos cotidianos. Para su futuro, piensa comprar ms terrenos productivos y plantar mayor cantidad de caf. Este es la tercera vez que tiene un crdito con MFP, y esta segura de trabajar de manera activa como hasta ahora, pues le gusta laborar co su grupo comunal. Con el crdito que recibir, comprar varios sacos de abono, que esparcir sobre sus plantaciones de caf.
texts.en:
Elsa is a very hardworking woman who is 30 years old and lives with her partner Nilton, who is also 30 years old and with whom she has 2 children, who are her adoration. They live together in their own house. She has been working in agriculture for 10 years. Her parents taught her this work and that is why now she and her husband are teaching all of the agricultural techniques to their children, who occasionally help them with small jobs in the field, cultivating coffee, plantains, and avocadoes. She enjoys very much the different kinds of work she does in the fields and when she needs to make her work go more quickly she hires workers. In this way she can rest assured, knowing that she will have good production. Elsa is very prudent because she is convinced that a good harvest depends on being attentive. She considers her work in agriculture to be quite profitable, because it allows her to buy land, educate her children, and to cover a variety of daily expenses. For the future she plans to buy some more land that is productive and to plant a larger amount of coffee. This is the third time she has had a loan with MFP and she is sure to continue working hard like she has up to this point because she likes working with her communal bank. With the loan she will receive she will buy several sacks of fertilizer, which she will use on her coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loan.name: Vilma Roxana

texts.es:
Vilma Roxana M. M. tiene 30 anos. Es soltera y vive con su familia en el cantn de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios.
